quote: The way to fame goes through the palaces, the way to happiness goes through the markets, the way to virtue goes through the deserts.
author: Chinese Proverb

quote: Do not be proud, no matter what high position you occupy in life. In you and in me and in every other person lives the same God, the same life force; you look down on me in vain; we are all equal beings.
author: Indian Wisdom

quote: I am filled with a great thought: that of the greatness of my soul, its unity with God. My soul is not united with God in submission, but through its ability to understand Him, and through Him, to be eternal.
author: Henri Amiel

quote: We should hope that the day will come when all people perceive that the life of a man is great only in its service to his brothers, for he is united with them by God.
author: Edward Brown

quote: Powerful forces are at work in this world. No one can stop them. We see their signs in a new understanding of religion, a new respect for people, a new feeling of brotherhood.
author: William Ellery Channing

quote: You cannot sell your talent, your genius; as soon as you do, you are a prostitute. You can sell your work, but not your soul.
author: John Ruskin

quote: Intolerant and power-hungry priests and pastors bring about the negation of religion.
author: William Warburton

quote: Unbelievers can be equally intolerant as those who believe with crude, primitive understanding.
author: Jean France Duclos

quote: Believe in God, serve Him, but don’t try to understand His essence. You will get nothing from your painful efforts except disappointment and fatigue. Do not even strive to find out whether he exists or not, just serve him as if he does, as if he is present everywhere. Nothing else is necessary.
author: Philemon

quote: No one except God comprehends the secret of the great beginning; no one can step outside himself.
author: Omar Khayyam

quote: The following words were carved on the bathroom of the king Jinx-Hang: “Renew yourself completely every day, and starting afresh, from the beginning.”
author: Chinese Wisdom

quote: The journey of the wise to virtue is as a journey to a remote land, or the ascent of a high mountain. People who travel to a faraway place start with a single step, and those who climb a high mountain start from the bottom.
author: Confucius

quote: And Jesus said unto him, No man, having put his hand to the plow, and looking back, is fit for the kingdom of God.
author: Luke9:62

quote:
Then came Peter to him, and said, Lord, how oft shall my brother sin against me, and I forgive him? till seven times?

  Jesus saith unto him, I say not unto thee, Until seven times: but, Until seventy times seven.
author: Matthew18:21-22

quote: The American Indians had no laws, no punishments, and no government. They obeyed the moral understanding of good and evil that is part of every human nature.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: People jump back and forth in pursuit of pleasures only because they see the emptiness of their lives more clearly than they do the emptiness of whichever new entertainment attracts them.
author: Blaise Pascal

quote: Do not bother about what will happen someday, somewhere, in the far away distance, in a future time; think and be very attentive to what happens now, here, in this place.
author: John Ruskin

quote: At that time Jesus answered and said, I thank thee, O Father, Lord of heaven and earth, because thou hast hid these things from the wise and prudent, and hast revealed them unto babes. Even so, Father: for so it seemed good in thy sight.
author: Matthew11:25-26

quote: The world would be a terrible place without newborn children, who bring with them innocence, and the hope of man’s further perfection.
author: John Ruskin

quote: Childhood is blessed by heaven because it brings a piece of paradise into the cruelties of life. All these thousands of everyday births are fresh additions of innocence and purity, which fight against the end of mankind, and against our spoiled nature, and against our complete immersion into sin.
author: Henri Amiel

quote: O Lord our Lord, how excellent is thy name in all the earth! who hast set thy glory above the heavens. Out of the mouth of babes and sucklings hast thou ordained strength because of thine enemies, that thou mightest still the enemy and the avenger.
author: Psalms8:1-2

quote: Science fulfills its purpose, not when it explains the reasons for the dark spots on the sun, but when it understands and explains the laws of our own life, and the consequences of violating these laws.
author: John Ruskin

quote: A Christian who does not know where he goes (John 3:8), or what is given to him by God (John 3:34), does not know his life’s real purpose.
author: Fyodor Strakhov

quote: As our self-interest diminishes, our anxieties disappear, and then comes quiet and firm joy, which always diffuses us with a good spiritual disposition and a clear conscience. Every good deed helps to kindle this feeling of joy within us. The egoist feels lonely, surrounded by threatening and alien events; all his desires are sunk in his own concerns. A kind person lives in a world of beneficent events, whose goodness matches his own.
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: A person who lives only for the concerns of his body may become lost in the labyrinth of an animal and sensual life, while the soul will always find truth; it will find the way.
author: Lucy Malory

quote: The love of great wealth commends you, “Bring me your soul as a sacrifice,” and people will do so.
author: Saint John Chrysostom

quote: Excessive dress prevents the body from moving freely. Excessive wealth interferes with the movements of our soul.
author: Demosthenes

quote: The desire for wealth can never be satisfied. Those who have it are excited by the wish to have more, and yet more.
author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

quote: A wise man looks for everything inside of himself; a madman seeks for everything in others.
author: Confucius

quote: I never complain about my fate. Once, I did not have shoes, and I complained to God. I went into church with a heavy heart and in the church I saw a man without both feet. So I thanked God that he had given me both feet, and that my only problem was that they were unshod.
author: Muslih-Ud-Din Saadi

quote: A wise man innately knows how to act without searching, because he has the divine within himself. The further you search and seek, the less you know.
author: Lao-Tzu

quote: You should treat your thoughts the way you treat your self, and treat your wishes the way you treat your children.
author: Chinese Wisdom

quote: A person is not created either to subdue others, or to follow the orders of others. People are corrupted by both ways of behavior. In the first they assume too much importance, in the second, too little respect. In both ways there is very little dignity.
author: Victor Considérant

quote: Our life would become wonderful if we could see all the disgusting things which exist in it.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: Subduing people through violence is never justice.
author: Blaise Pascal

quote: He who depends on violence behaves wrongly. The maker of beautiful speeches is not wise, only he who is free from hatred and fear is truly wise.
author: Buddhist Wisdom

quote: In real life illusions can only transform our life for a moment, but in the domain of thoughts and the intellect, misconceptions may be accepted as truth for thousands of years, and make a laughingstock of whole nations, mute the noble wishes of mankind, make slaves from people and lie to them. These misconceptions are the enemies with which the wisest men in the history of mankind try to struggle. The force of the truth is great, but its victory is difficult. However, once you receive this victory, it can never be taken from you.
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: Freeing a person from misconceptions, false truths, and lies does not take anything from him; it gives him something important.
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: Disbelief is not when a person believes or does not believe in something. It is when he prophesies those things in which he does not believe.
author: Harriet Martineau

quote: A wise man has doubts even in his best moments. Real truth is always accompanied by hesitations. If I could not hesitate, I could not believe.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: You cannot say that the existing laws regarding the possession of land are lawful. Violence, crime, and power have their source in these laws.
author: Herbert Spencer

quote: Private ownership of land came to be, not out of any natural relationships between people, but through robbery.
author: Henry George

quote: The divine spark lives in all of us, and perpetually strives toward its origin.
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: When you see that everything around you is impermanent, then you will perceive other, permanent and eternal things.
author: Dhammapada, A Book Of Buddhist Wisdom

quote: You cannot see the soul, but only the soul can truly see the essence of things.
author: The Talmud

quote: I call spirit that part of man which has independent existence and gives us the understanding of life.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: Religious disbelief and neglect is a great evil, but prejudice and lies are even worse.
author: Plutarchus

quote: Life is short. Do not forget about the most important things in our life, living for other people and doing good for them.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: The Son of man came not to be ministered unto, but to minister, and to give his life as a ransom for many.
author: Matthew20:28

quote: Bad things are easy to do, good things are done only with work and effort.
author: Dhammapada, A Book Of Buddhist Wisdom

quote: Enter by the narrow gate; for the gate is wide, and the way is broad that leads to destruction, and many are those who enter by it. For the gate is small, and the way is narrow that leads to life, and few are those who find it.
author: Matthew7:13-14

quote: The way to true knowledge does not go through soft grass covered with flowers. To find it, a person must climb steep mountains.
author: John Ruskin

quote: Look for the truth; it wants to be found.
author: Blaise Pascal

quote: Work toward the purification of your thoughts. Without bad thoughts you will be incapable of bad deeds.
author: Confucius

quote: We cannot prevent birds from flying over our heads, but we can keep them from making nests on top of our heads. Similarly, bad thoughts sometimes appear in our mind, but we can choose whether we allow them to live there, to create a nest for themselves, and to breed evil deeds.
author: Martin Luther

quote: It is a sin, not only to do bad things, but even to think about bad things.
author: Zoroaster

quote: The soul does not live in the body as in a house, but as in a tent, a place of temporary dwelling.
author: Indian Wisdom

quote: Who brought me into this world? According to whose command do I find myself at this exact place, during this particular time? Life is the remembrance of a very short day we spent visiting this world.
author: Blaise Pascal

quote: Mortal people cannot live long; we have only a few moments. But our soul does not age. It believes in eternal things, and it will live for all eternity.
author: Toriclidis

quote: Socrates did not have the weakness of many scholars, the desire to know about all possible things, to learn the origins and explanations of things—what the Sophists call “the nature of things”—and to uncover the origins of the celestial bodies. Socrates said, “Is it true that people are so concerned with these earthly things? People wrongly think that they should know everything. They think that they can despise the most necessary and important fields of knowledge, and penetrate the mysteries that do not belong to us.”
author: Xenophon

quote: Not only is real science not hostile to religion, in fact real science always supports it.
author: John Ruskin

quote: Knowledge is limitless, and the most scholarly and educated person is as far from true knowledge as an uneducated peasant.
author: John Ruskin

quote: We cannot imagine the scope of our ignorance, just as a blind man cannot imagine darkness until he can see.
author: Immanuel Kant

quote: What nature of struggle for existence or kind of madness forces you to shed blood with your hands in order to eat animals? Why do this, if you have all the comforts of life?
author: Plutarch

quote: It is not enough to be a hardworking person. Think: what do you work at?
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: All the world is subject to one law, and all thinking beings have the same basic intellect. Therefore, all wise men share the same idea of perfection.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: The more I dedicate my time to two things, the more they fill my life with ever-increasing pleasure. The first is the sky above me, and the second is the moral law within me.
author: Immanuel Kant

quote: Therefore all things whatsoever ye would that men should do to you, do ye even so to them: for this is the law and the prophets.
author: Matthew7:12

quote: If you want to blame me, you should not be with me. You should be inside me.
author: Adam Mickiewicz

quote: Our greatest imperfections are in our inner vision. We are so shortsighted that we cannot see bad things in others, but we cannot find bad things in ourselves as well.
author: Edward Brown

quote: You should be brave enough to use your own intellect, in life and in your education.
author: Immanuel Kant

quote: Is there anything more absurd than a person having a right to kill me because we live on two opposite banks of the river, and our kings quarrel with each other?
author: Blaise Pascal

quote: The time will come when people will understand the stupidities of war.
author: Charles Riche

quote: European countries have about four million people serving in the army. Two thirds of their budget are spent on military spending.
author: Gustave De Molinari

quote: In the important questions of life, we are always alone. Our deepest inner thoughts cannot be understood by others. The best part of the drama that goes on deep in our soul is a monologue, or, better to say, a very sincere conversation between God, our conscience, and ourself.
author: Henri Amiel

quote: You should study more to understand that you know little.
author: Michel De Montaigne

quote: Never be ashamed to admit what you do not know.
author: Arabic Proverb

quote: Put everything to the test, holdfast to that which is good.
author: I Thessalonians5:21

quote: It is difficult if not impossible to find some reasonable limit for acquiring more and more property.
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: You should acquire the kind of wealth which cannot be stolen from you by thieves, which people in power cannot take from you, which will stay with you even after your death, never diminishing and never disappearing. This wealth is your soul.
author: Indian Proverb

quote: A holy person lives in the world, but he is concerned most of all about his attitude to people. He can feel all people, and he can sense all people, and all people turn their ears and eyes to him.
author: Lao-Tzu

quote: Without love nothing can bring you goodness, and every action inspired with love, even if it seems small and unimportant, will bring you some fruits afterward.
author: The Book Ofdivinethoughts

quote: Religion is the highest form of love.
author: Theodore Parker

quote: What is not clear should be cleared up. What is not easy to do should be done with great persistence.
author: Confucius

quote: We suffer from our vices, and try to struggle with them, and the reason for this struggle is that we are not perfect. But our salvation is in this struggle with vices, and if God were to take away our ability to fight our vices, then we would be left with them forever.
author: Blaise Pascal

quote: Illnesses of the mind are much more dangerous than illnesses of the body.
author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

quote: Let us think about God, remember Him, and talk to Him as often as we can.
author: Epictetus

quote: God is not an idol; he is an ideal which we should strive for in our everyday life.
author: Lucy Mallory

quote: All beginnings are mysteries, the mystery of creation.
author: Henri Amiel

quote: Contemporary science cannot teach you about God and His virtues. The sciences cannot make you virtuous, but they help you on your way.
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: That which is born of the flesh is flesh; and that which is born of the Spirit is spirit. Marvel not that I said unto thee, Ye must be born again. The wind bloweth where it listeth, and thou hearest the sound thereof, but canst not tell whence it cometh, and whither it goeth: so is every one that is born of the Spirit.
author: John3:6-8

quote: The souls of wise people look to the future state of their existence; all of their thoughts are concentrated toward eternity.
author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

quote: There is not a single soul that can be good without God.
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: Any departure from accepted traditions and customs requires a large and serious effort, but true understanding of new things always requires such an effort.
author: Lucy Malory

quote: You should behave as you think is good, but not following the advice of the crowd.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: In those countries where wise people are in power, their subjects do not notice the existence of their rulers.
author: Lao-Tzu

quote: If your tongue speaks good, there is nothing better in the world; if your tongue speaks evil, there is nothing worse.
author: The Talmud

quote: I have spent all my life amongst wise people, and I found nothing better than silence in this world. If a word costs one coin, then silence costs two. Silence suits clever people, and it suits wise people even more.
author: The Talmud

quote: Let your tongue become accustomed to the words “I do not know.”
author: Eastern Wisdom

quote: God is close to us he is with us: the divine spirit is inside of us. If he were not, the power to be good would be beyond our reach. A person cannot be good without God.
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: Then Jesus said unto them, Yet a little while is the light with you. Walk while ye have the light, lest darkness come upon you: for he that walketh in darkness knoweth not whither he goeth.
author: John12:35

quote: Everyone knows that our habits are improved and strengthened through their exercise. In order to be a good walker, you need to walk a lot; in order to be a strong runner, you need to run frequently; in order to be a perceptive reader, you ought to read as much as you can. The same is true of your soul: if you become angry, you must know that you not only perform evil, but you also create an evil habit, and you increase your potential for further evil.
author: Epictetus

quote: Woe to the people who look without understanding, who do not know their foundations.
author: The Talmud

quote: Every bird always knows where to make her nest. And if she knows how and where to make her nest, this means that she knows her purpose in life. And why does man, who is the wisest among all creatures, not know that which any bird knows, that is, his purpose in life?
author: Chinese Wisdom

quote: The life of man is filled with intellect only when the fulfillment of your duty is understood. We all know for sure that death waits for us. We do not know when, just as we do not know where we came from.
author: Henry George

quote: Virtue is a service which a person should do for himself. If there were no heaven and no God who ruled this world, even then virtue would be the necessary law of life.
author: Indian Wisdom

quote: People with great and wonderful souls are always quiet and happy. Those people who do not have spirituality are always unhappy.
author: Chinese Proverb

quote: Do not be concerned too much with what will happen. Everything which happens will be good and useful for you.
author: Epictetus

quote: A person will understand his place in the world only when he understands his soul.
author: Chinese Wisdom

quote: The human soul, not by itself, but by some power, is pushed closer and closer to truth and goodness, and the better we understand this, the more humble we will be.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: Conscience is the real judge between good and bad, conscience is what makes a person similar to God, and conscience is the greatest advantage of human nature. Without conscience there would be nothing that would raise us above the animals, and people would move from one lie to another.
author: Jean Jacques Rousseau

quote: The purpose of your life is not to do as the majority does, but to live according to the inner law which you understand in yourself. Do not act against your conscience or against truth. Live like this, and you will fulfill the task of your life.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: Compassion expressed in response to rage is the same as water for fire. When you are in a rage, try to feel compassion for the other person, and then your rage will disappear.
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: You hide from your misfortunes. But if you knew what other people suffered, then you would not complain about your own.
author: Solon

quote: A king asked a holy man, “Do you remember about me?” The holy man answered, “Yes, I think about you, when I forget about God.”
author: Muslih-Ud-Din Saadi

quote: We fulfill the law of God when we feel the lives of others as our own life.
author: Giuseppe Mazzini

quote: The second things are much more important than the first.
author: François Fénelon

quote: A person understands himself not through thoughts, but with actions. It is only through making an effort that a person will understand his worth.
author: Johann Wolfgang Von Goethe

quote: Do not believe that in religion you cannot trust your intellect. The force of our intellect must support the foundations of every real faith.
author: William Ellery Channing

quote: If God, the object of our faith, is higher than our understanding, and if you do not understand Him, it does not mean that you should not use your intellect trying to understand Him.
author: Fyodor Strakhov

quote: While ye have light, believe in the light, that ye may be the children of light. These things spake Jesus, and departed, and did hide himself from them.
author: John12:36

quote: Pain is the necessary condition of our body, and suffering is the necessary condition of our spiritual life, from birth to death.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: You should welcome everything which happens to you from birth to death, because the existence and the purpose of the world is in these cases.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: Only in the storm can you see the art of the real sailor; only on the battlefield can you see the bravery of a soldier. The courage of a simple person can be seen in how he copes with the difficult and dangerous situations in life.
author: Daniel Achinsky

quote: Those who are not afraid of truly terrible things follow false examples and those people follow the path to destruction.
author: Dhammapada, A Book Of Buddhist Wisdom

quote: People say that God created mankind after his image. This means that man created God after his image.
author: George Lichtenberg

quote: If we believe in the things we were taught, there is goodness and evil at the same time.
author: Henry George

quote: And the apostles said unto the Lord, Increase our faith. And the Lord said, If ye had faith as a grain of mustard seed, ye might say unto this sycamine tree, Be thou plucked up by the root, and be thou planted in the sea; and it should obey you. But which of you, having a servant plowing or feeding cattle, will say unto him by and by, when he is come from the field, Go and sit down to meat? And will not rather say unto him, Make ready wherewith I may sup, and gird thyself, and serve me, till I have eaten and drunken; and afterward thou shalt eat and drink? Doth he thank that servant because he did the things that were commanded him? I trow not. So likewise ye, when ye shall have done all those things which are commanded you, say, We are unprofitable servants: we have done that which was our duty to do.
author: Luke17:5-10

quote: Truly kind people forget the good things they have done in the past. They are so involved in the things they do now that they forget the things they have done before.
author: Chinese Wisdom

quote: The better a person knows himself, the smaller and less significant he seems to himself and the higher he elevates himself toward God.
author: Thomas À Kempis

quote: We are not satisfied with our real life. We want to live an imaginary life, a life in which we seem different in the eyes of other people than we are in reality.
author: Blaise Pascal

quote: Those human laws are good which are based on the law of God. Those human laws are bad which contradict the laws of God; we should change these laws.
author: Giuseppe Mazzini

quote: You should abstain from arguments. They are very illogical ways to convince people. Opinions are like nails: the stronger you hit them, the deeper inside they go.
author: Decimus Junius Juvenalis

quote: If you live alone, think about your own sins; if you are in society, forget about the sins of others.
author: Chinese Wisdom

quote: In order that a lamp can give good light, you should put it in a place protected from the wind. If the light is in the wind, then it will leave long, trembling shadows. So too will bad thoughts drop shadows on the white surface of your soul.
author: Indian Wisdom

quote: Establish your purpose when you are alone and without temptations.
author: Jeremy Bentham

quote: Meditation is the way to eternity; lightheartedness is the way to death. Those who meditate never die; those who are lighthearted remind me of death.
author: Buddhist Wisdom

quote: Be strict to yourself and forgive others, and then you will have no enemies.
author: Chinesewisdom

quote: I cannot stop thinking that I was dead before I was born, and at my death I will return to the same state.
author: George Lichtenberg

quote: I do not regret that I was born here and that I lived part of my life here, because I lived in a way that I think was useful. When the end comes, I will leave my life in the same way, as if I leave an inn and not my home, because I think that my stay in this life is temporary and that death is only a transfer to another state.
author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

quote: Even if I err in saying that the soul is eternal, nevertheless I am happy that I made this mistake. And while I am alive, not a single person can take away this assurance which gives me complete calmness and great satisfaction.
author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

quote: The question is whether the intellectual one, without the heart, can understand God. The truth is that if our heart understands God our intellect will then start to seek Him.
author: George Lichtenberg

quote: The basic foundation of the understanding of God is inside of us.
author: William Ellery Channing

quote: Those who do not hate their own selfishness, their placing of themselves higher than the rest of the world, are blind, because this action contradicts the truth.
author: Blaise Pascal

quote: The lighter and less dense a substance is, the less space it occupies. The qualities which a proud person attributes to himself can be compared to this.
author: Eastern Wisdom

quote: In 1682, a Dr. Leyton, a respected citizen of England who wrote a book criticizing a bishop, was put on trial and severely punished. First he was harshly beaten, then one ear was cut away. After several days he was beaten again, though the injuries on his back had not healed; then they cut off his second ear, and tore off his nose. This was done in the name of Christianity.
author: Randall Thomas Davidson

quote: Christ never founded any church, never created any state, never passed any law, never established any government or other authority. He wanted to put the law of God into the hearts of people, to make them self-governed.
author: Herbert Newton

quote: My intellect teaches me that land cannot be sold.
author: Blackhawk

quote: The land shall not be sold for ever: for the land is mine; for ye are strangers and sojourners with me.
author: Leviticus25:23

quote: To be honest, the earth has two masters: the first is almighty God and the second are his sons; all the people who have worked and will work on it.
author: Thomas Carlyle

quote: All people, from the first, and without any judicial act, should possess the earth. They should be able to live where nature and chance have brought them.
author: Immanuel Kant

quote: A person should always develop his ability to do goodness. Make yourself better; this should be every person’s goal.
author: Immanuel Kant

quote: The first rule of achieving goodness is this: think only about self-perfection, and do so without thought to being praised by others.
author: Chinese Wisdom

quote: He who moves from doing bad deeds to doing good deeds enlightens this world like the moon coming out from behind the clouds. This is the best thing in the world; this is the first step toward divinity.
author: Dhammapada, A Book Of Buddhist Wisdom

quote: Your will is not good until you have changed the habits of your intellect, and they will improve only when they follow the eternal laws of life.
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: Only those who have real knowledge know what to do.
author: Indianwisdom

quote: Wherever your heart is, there will be your treasure. The heart of a person whose major treasure is wealth is buried in filth.
author: Saint John Chrysostom

quote: Why should a person be rich? Why should he have expensive horses, rich clothes, wonderful rooms, and the leisure to visit public places of entertainment? Because he does not have enough thoughts to accompany his intellect. Give this person the inner work of his intellect, and he will be happier than the richest man.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: There is only one true religion, though there are many different faiths.
author: Immanuel Kant

quote: It is only faith which creates the powerful convictions, the energy, and the unity which can cure society.
author: Giuseppe Mazzini

quote: Be attentive to the present. Only in the present time can we understand eternity.
author: Johann Wolfgang Von Goethe

quote: Use your body, your vessel, today; tomorrow it can be broken.
author: The Talmud

quote: Life alone is not good. Goodness exists only in a proper, virtuous life.
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: It is not a virtue, but a kind of deceitful similitude, to fulfill our duty for the purpose of its reward.
author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

quote: I call this life a happy one in which I do one good deed after another, with no intervals between them.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: If in the morning a person wants to do evil unto others, evil will return to him by nightfall.
author: Indian Wisdom

quote: The evildoer harms himself first, before he harms others.
author: Saint Augustine

quote: Every man becomes what he teaches others to be. Those who gain victory over themselves will gain victory over others. It is most difficult to achieve victory over oneself. Every man has power only over himself.
author: Dhammapada, A Book Of Buddhist Wisdom

quote: But beware of men: for they will deliver you up to the councils, and they will scourge you in their synagogues; And ye shall be brought before governors and kings for my sake, for a testimony against them and the Gentiles. But when they deliver you up, take no thought how or what ye shall speak: for it shall be given you in that same hour what ye shall speak. For it is not ye that speak, but the Spirit of your Father which speaketh in you.
author: Matthew10:17-20

quote: Right cannot be defeated, because it is done not by your will but according to the eternal laws of God.
author: Thomas Carlyle

quote: Every time you wake up and ask yourself, “What good things am I going to do today?” remember that, when the sun goes down at sunset, it will take a part of your life with it.
author: Indian Proverb

quote: The virtue of a person is measured not by his outstanding efforts, but by his everyday behavior.
author: Blaise Pascal

quote: It is as wrong for one person to rule many as it is for many to rule one.
author: Vladimir Chertkov

quote: What is truth? For the majority of people, truth is the majority of counted votes.
author: Thomas Carlyle

quote: When I sit on the seashore and listen to the waves beating on the sand, I feel free from any obligation, and I think that all the people of the world can change their constitutions without me.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: Do not think that you are generous because you give your excess wealth to a poor person. Real generosity requires that you give this person a place in your heart.
author: The Book Ofdivinethoughts

quote: You should be truthful; you should avoid wrath; you should give to those who ask, because they ask for small things. You will become holier by following these three paths.
author: Dhammapada, A Book Of Buddhist Wisdom

quote: With humbleness, kindness, and self-sacrifice, you will take the weapon from any enemy. Any fire dies if there is insufficient wood.
author: Buddhist Wisdom

quote: People of planet Earth are on a very low level of development. Every day in the newspapers you read the news about military treaties, about the preparations for war, for mass manslaughter. People do not understand that the life of each man is his own personal private property.
author: Camille Flammarion

quote: Beware of those who want to convince you that it is impossible to strive for good just because it is impossible to reach perfection.
author: John Ruskin

quote: It is difficult to hringpeople to goodness with lessons, but it is easy to do so by example.
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: You should be a lantern for yourself. Draw close to the light within you and seek no other shelter.
author: Buddhist Wisdom

quote: A person’s soul may be compared to a transparent ball which is lit from the inside with its own light. This flame is not only the source of all light and truth, but it illuminates everything around you. In this state, the soul is free and happy. Only if it becomes addicted to anything outside you will it become troubled, darkened, and impenetrable. Distractions obstruct the light which shows you the way.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: The soul is a mirror in which you can see the reflection of divine intellect.
author: John Ruskin

quote: The future is only an illusion inferred from our present state. What is important is not the length of life, but the depth of life. What is most important is not to make life longer, but to take your soul out of time, as every sublime act does. Only then does your life become fulfilled. And do not ask yourself questions about time. Jesus did not explain a thing about the eternity of life, but his influence brought people to the eternal.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Do not say words you do not feel, lest your soul be blackened with darkness.
author: The Book Ofdivinethoughts

quote: A wise man does not judge a person for his words, but at the same time does not neglect another person’s wordsy even when these words are pronounced by an unworthy person.
author: Chinese Wisdom

quote: A person’s tongue is a tool which is sufficient to transmit the ideas created by the human mind. But in the domain of true and deep feelings, our tongue is weak.
author: Lajos Kossuth

quote: People who try to force circumstances become their slaves. Those who use them become their masters.
author: The Talmud

quote:
There is nothing in this world more tender and more pliable than water, yet hard and rigid things cannot resist it.

  Weakness defeats strength, tenderness defeats rigidity. Everyone knows this law, but no one acts upon it. The weakest in the world gain victory over the strongest; therefore, there is a great advantage in humility and silence. Only a few people in this world are truly humble.
author: Lao-Tzu

quote: If a woman’s kindness is boundless, then her rage can also have no limits. A good wife is the best gift for a husband, and an evil wife is a terrible ulcer for a man.
author: The Talmud

quote: The more beautiful a woman is, the more honest she should be because it is only through honesty that she can deal with all the evil and damage which her beauty can produce.
author: Gotthold Ephraim Lessing

quote: Reading and writing do not educate if they do not help people to become kinder to all animals.
author: John Ruskin

quote: I do not grieve that a person dies, that he loses his money, his estate, or all his property, all that can belong to a man. But it is a great pity when a person loses his greatest possession, his human dignity.
author: Epictetus

quote: In our time, people forget that first of all they should respect the human being in themselves.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote:
Ours is the age of criticism.

  Religion and law try to escape from criticism, religion by saying that it is divine and law by showing that it is powerful. But some suspicions arise from this escape, because we can respect only those things which stand up in free and public trial.
author: Immanuel Kant

quote: Study everything, and put intellect first.
author: Pythagoras

quote: Ignorance cannot lead to evil, misconceptions lead to evil. It’s not what people do know, it’s what they pretend that they do.
author: Jean Jacques Rousseau

quote: Every misconception is a poison: there are no harmless misconceptions.
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: One of the evil properties of man is that he loves only himself and wants goodness only for himself. But woe to him who loves only himself!
author: Blaise Pascal

quote: Truly, truly, I say to you, unless a grain of wheat falls into the earth and dies, it remains by itself alone; but if it dies, it bears much fruit. He who loves his life loses it, and he who hates his life in this world shall keep it to life eternal.
author: John12:24-25

quote: Life is changing all the time, and only the ignorant do not look into the depth of things.
author: Lucy Malory

quote: Why are you so afraid of change? Nothing in this world can be done without change. Only one rule should remain constant: do not do anything inhumane to others.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: Everything in this world blooms, grows, and returns to its roots. Returning to one’s roots means becoming united with nature; becoming united with nature involves eternity. The destruction of your body holds no danger in itself.
author: Lao-Tzu

quote: The law of right living is not immediately clear to the wise man, but it becomes much clearer when he follows it. The law of right living is immediately clear to the ordinary person, but it becomes less obvious when he tries to follow it.
author: Confucius

quote: There is only one eternal law. It does not change and it governs all people at all times.
author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

quote: Lost souls escape their loss of control in patriotism.
author: Dr. Samuel Johnson

quote: Woe to the world because of its stumbling block! For it is inevitable that stumbling blocks come; but woe to that man through whom the stumbling block comes! And if your hand or your foot cause you to stumble, cut it off and throw it from you; it is better for you to enter life crippled or lame than having two hands and two feet, to be cast into the eternal fire.
author: Matthew18:7-9

quote: One of the major obstacles impeding any positive future change in our lives is that we are too busy with our current work or activity. Levi quit his tax-work, Peter stopped fishing at a lake, Paul ceased being a priest. They all left their jobs because they thought it was necessary.
author: John Ruskin

quote: If a person’s hand is not damaged, then it can withstand the bite of a poisonous snake. Its poison poses no danger to a healthy hand. Evil is harmless for him who is not an evildoer.
author: Buddhist Wisdom

quote: False shame is the devil’s favorite emotion; it is even worse than false pride. Pride can support evil, but false shame stops goodness.
author: John Ruskin

quote: The best food is the food you or your children make by yourself.
author: Mohammed

quote: Those who provide for their own food by themselves deserve more respect than those who claim to be religious.
author: The Talmud

quote: You can stand firm in a fight against everything except kindness.
author: Jean Jacques Rousseau

quote: It is not the blaming of evil but the glorifying of goodness that creates harmony in our life.
author: Lucy Malory

quote: In the same way that fireworks and torches cannot be seen in the light of the sun, the best intellect and the greatest beauty cannot be seen in the light of the kindness of a single heart.
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: The most tender plants can push their way through the hardest rocks, and it is the same with kindness. Nothing can stop a truly kind and sincere person.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: The person does not exist to whom you cannot do good.
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: During the day you should behave in such a way that you can sleep at night in peace; and in your youth you should behave in such a way that you can live in your old age in peace.
author: Indian Proverb

quote: Those who have weak faith themselves cannot arouse faith in others.
author: Lao-Tzu

quote: Those who give second place to God in their hearts do not give Him a place at all.
author: John Ruskin

quote: A person who becomes close to God understands that God lives within him. Angelus, a mystical poet of the seventeenth century, said, “I see God with the same eye with which He sees me.”
author: Henri Amiel

quote: The soul of a person is the lamp of God.
author: The Talmud

quote: People do not know what God looks like but they live in Him and He in them.
author: Sufi Wisdom, A Mystical Sect In Islam

quote: The nature of a soul is so mysterious that no matter how hard we try to understand it, we will never be able to define it.
author: Heraclitus

quote: All goodness is as nothing compared to the goodness of truth; all sweets are as nothing compared to the sweetness of truth. The bliss of truth surpasses all other joys in the world.
author: Buddhist Wisdom

quote: If you raise people to praise only wealth, power, and glory, then naturally they will praise only these things. If you raise people to love the feeling of love, they will start to live in love.
author: Mee-Tee, A Student Of Confucius

quote: For the body is not one member, but many…. And if one member suffers, all the members suffer with it; if one member is honored, all the members rejoice with it.
author: I Corinthians12:14,26

quote: A small branch cut off from a big limb is separated from the whole tree. In the same way when a person is in an argument with another person, he is separated from all humanity.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: God created heaven and earth, but they lacked the ability to understand the happiness of their existence. Then God made creatures who could understand the happiness of their existence, and who could create a single body from all of its thinking parts. All people are members of this one body; in order to be happy, they should live in harmony with the will that governs its life. We should live in harmony with this great soul and love it more than we love ourselves.
author: Blaise Pascal

quote: Do not be embarrassed by all your bad deeds, by all your misfortunes. Do not be embarrassed, but fight ceaselessly, bravely, and without hesitation, because the kingdom of God will come.
author: F. Robert De Lamennais

quote: Life has no meaning without purpose. To lack purpose is to deny the existence of God and to admit that our life is an evil, stupid joke.
author: Giuseppe Mazzini

quote: All our history proves that God may be understood, not by reasoning, but by submission to Him and obeyance to His laws. Only by doing this can we understand His will on earth.
author: John Ruskin

quote: Everything which can make us better and happier was given to us by God. If our conscience is clear, then nothing can harm us.
author: Epictetus

quote: They who have decided to dedicate their lives to spiritual perfection will never be dissatisfied or unhappy, because all that they want is in their power.
author: Blaise Pascal

quote: Happiness, pure happiness, is a virtue in itself.
author: Benedictus Spinoza

quote: We should separate the religion that was taught by Jesus from the religion whose subject is Jesus. Then we will understand the real meaning of the New Testament and follow it.
author: Henri Amiel

quote: In different ways and in different tongues, all humanity repeats the words of the Lord’s prayer, “Let thy kingdom come on earth as it is in heaven.”
author: Giuseppe Mazzini

quote: How good a person feels when, exhausted from striving for goodness in his everyday life, he stretches out his hands to God.
author: Blaise Pascal

quote: Civilization is first of all a moral thing. Without truth, respect for duty, love of neighbor, virtue, everything is destroyed. The morality of a society is alone the basis of civilization.
author: Henri Amiel

quote: The proper direction of man’s thought is not toward the creation of new laws for government, but toward the acceptance of every person’s moral dignity.
author: Edmund Yates

quote: Socialism, when compared with Christianity, is a rather minor, secondary question about the material needs of the working class. It stands outside the basic questions of human life.
author: Fyodor Strakhov

quote: We should, first of all, understand that we are all children of the same father, and we should fulfill the same general law: live not for ourselves, but to help others be happy.
author: Giuseppe Mazzini

quote: He who understands his soul will understand the divine spark within himself.
author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

quote: Wise people cannot be sufficiently educated, and educated people cannot be sufficiently wise.
author: Lao-Tzu

quote: Older people who live spiritual lives ever widen their spiritual horizons, and ever expand their consciences. Older people who live only a daily routine become more and more stupid over the years.
author: The Talmud

quote: One becomes older in order to become kinder; there is no mistake which I have not already made.
author: Johann Wolfgang Von Goethe

quote: The growth and development of the soul is more important than power and glory.
author: Henri Amiel

quote: What use is it for children when people only speak about goodness, but perform bad deeds in reality?
author: Gustav Struve

quote: The strong desire for a pleasant and ideal life is a child’s worst misfortune. It is crucial that children should know how to work from an early age.
author: Immanuel Kant

quote: Instead of saying that the world is reflected in our intellect, better to say that our intellect is reflected in the world.
author: George Lichtenberg

quote: The universe is limitless, and impossible for anyone to understand. Therefore, we cannot completely understand the life of our own body.
author: Blaise Pascal

quote: As long as there is violence, there will be war. One cannot defeat violence with more violence, only with nonresistance to and nonparticipation in it.
author: Leturno

quote: If my soldiers started thinking, not a single soldier would remain in my army.
author: Frederick Ii

quote: With time I understand the army code that dictates that a sergeant is always right when he addresses a soldier, that a lieutenant is always right when he addresses a sergeant, and so on up to generals and marshals, even when a person says that two times two equals five. If you do not obey your superior, you are punished by death, or years in prison.
author: Edward Ekman

quote: Do we understand our spiritual fraternity? Do we understand that we originated from one divine Father whose image we carry in ourselves and for whose perfection we strive? Have we accepted that there is the same divine life in all people, as well as in ourselves? And that this makes a natural and free bond among people?
author: William Ellery Channing

quote: We can love neither those whom we fear nor those who fear us.
author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

quote: “Time passes by!” we say. Time does not exist; only we move.
author: The Talmud

quote: I consist of spirit and body. Time affects the body, but the life of the spirit has no meaning either in the past or in the future. All its life is concentrated in the present.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: Divine spirit is eternal, it exists out of time. Limitless time and space are divided into small, limited parts to be used by limited beings.
author: Henri Amiel

quote: The soul is put into our body, so that it can understand the notion of date and time. It contemplates this fact and calls it “nature.”
author: Blaise Pascal

quote: Better to know a few things which are good and necessary than many things which are useless and mediocre.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The difference between real material poison and intellectual poison is that most material poison is disgusting to the taste, but intellectual poison, which takes the form of cheap newspapers or bad books, can unfortunately sometimes be attractive.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: One of the worst prejudices known is held by the majority of the so-called scholars of our time, who claim that a person can live without faith.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The essential meaning of every religion is to answer the question “Why do I live, and what is my attitude to the limitless world which surrounds me?” There is not a single religion, from the most sophisticated to the most primitive, which does not have as its basis the definition of this attitude of a person to the world.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The life of a person without faith is the life of an animal.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The most important question to keep before ourselves at all times is this: Do we do the right thing? During this short period of time which we call our life, do our acts conform to the will of the force that sent us into the world? Do we do the right thing?
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: When I am in difficult circumstances, I ask God to help me. But it is my duty to serve the Lord, and not His to serve me. As soon as I remember this, my burden becomes lighter.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Just imagine that the purpose of your life is your happiness only—then life becomes a cruel and senseless thing. You have to embrace what the wisdom of humanity, your intellect, and your heart tell you: that the meaning of life is to serve the force that sent you into the world. Then life becomes a constant joy.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Even if we don’t want to, we can’t help but feel our connection to the rest of mankind: we are connected by industry, by trade, by art, by knowledge, and most importantly, by our common mortality.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The history of mankind is the movement of humanity toward greater and greater unification.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Sometimes, the damage done by our words is obvious and sometimes it isn’t, but the damage is not any smaller for our not being able to see those people who suffer from our words.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Be afraid to destroy the unity of people by stirring bad feelings amongst them against another with your words.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: It’s important to strive to do good, and even more important to strive to abstain from evil.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: No matter how many times yon aim to achieve victory over your passions, do not give tip. Every effort weakens the power of passion and makes it easier to gain victory over it.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Kindness is necessary in relationships with people. If you are not kind to a person, you are not fulfilling your major obligation.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The kinder and the more thoughtful a person is, the more kindness he can find in other people.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Kindness enriches our life; with kindness mysterious things become clear, difficult things become easy, and dull things become cheerful.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Christian teaching is so simple that even small children can understand its meaning. Those people cannot understand it, and only those, who want to seem and to be called Christians without being real Christians.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Buddha said, “A man who starts to live for his soul is like a man who brings a lantern into a dark house. The darkness disappears at once. You have to be persistent in this, and your soul will have this light.”
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Christ expressed all His teachings in His last commandment: “Love each other, as I loved you. Everyone will see that you are my disciples, if you love each other.” He did not say, “If you believe,” but “If you love.” Faith can change with time, because our knowledge is constantly changing. Love, on the contrary, never changes; love is eternal.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: My religion is love to all living beings.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: In order to fulfill Christianity, we have to destroy its perversions and restore its purity.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Knowledge is real knowledge only when it is acquired by the efforts of your intellect, not by memory.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: A thought can advance your life in the right direction only when it answers questions which were asked by your soul. A thought which was first borrowed from someone else and then accepted by your mind and memory does not really much influence your life, and sometimes leads you in the wrong direction.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Read less, study less, but think more. Learn, both from your teachers and from the books which you read, only those things which you really need and which you really want to know.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The basis of all education is the establishment of our relationship to the beginning of all things, and the conclusions about our behavior which may be drawn from this.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Religious upbringing is the basis of all education.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Perfection is impossible without humility. “Why should I strive for perfection, if I am already good enough?”
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Remember all the bad things which you have done, and try to avoid doing bad things again. Remembering only your good deeds will interfere with your doing good in the future.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: There are people who take responsibility for making decisions for others and determining their relationship to God and to the world; and there are people, the overwhelming majority of them, who give this authority to the others, and blindly believe in everything they are told. Both groups of people commit an equal crime.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: A man should use that spiritual heritage which he has received from the wise and holy people of the past, but he should test everything with his intellect, accepting certain things and rejecting others.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Every person should define for himself his attitude to this world and to God.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Faith is the understanding of the meaning of life and the acceptance of those duties and responsibilities connected to it.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: You should not worry too much about what will happen after death. Deliver yourself to the divine creature and bless it: you know that it is love, therefore, why should you be afraid?
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: When Christ died, he said, “Father! I deliver my spirit into Thy hands.” Those who say these words, not with their tongue but with all their heart, do not need anything else. If my spirit returns back to its Father, this is the best place for it, and nothing can be better.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Don’t think that you can find peace for your soul without faith.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: You should love only one thing in yourself, that which is the same in all of us. In loving that which is the same in all of us, you love God.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: People live by love: love of yourself is the beginning of death; love of other people and of God is the beginning of life.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Love is not a source, it is a consequence of our understanding the divine, spiritual beginning which exists in all of us.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The greatest truth of the teachings of Christ is the direct connection between a man (God’s son) and God (His Father).
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Beware of everything which puts an obstacle between you and God.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: False faith is the major cause of most of our misfortunes.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The purpose of a human life is to bring the irrational beginning of our life to a rational beginning. In order to succeed in this, two things are important: (1) to see all irrational, unwise things in life and direct your attention to them and study them; (2) to understand the possibility of a rational, wise life. The major purpose of all teachers of mankind was the understanding of the irrational and rational beginnings in our life.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Accept the teaching of Christ as it is, clear and simple; then you will see that we live among big lies.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Live for your soul, and without trying or even understanding that you’re doing it, you will contribute to the improvement of society.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: It would be nice if wisdom had such a quality that it could flow from one man who is full of wisdom to another man who has no wisdom, just as with two connected vessels water flows from one vessel to the other until the water level is the same in both of them. The problem is that to obtain wisdom, you must make an independent, serious effort of your own.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Improve your own soul, and be confident that only in so doing can you contribute to the improvement of the larger society of which you are part.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: A scholar knows many books; a well-educated person has knowledge and skills; an enlightened person understands the meaning and purpose of his life.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: There are a limitless number of different sciences, but without one basic science, that is, what is the meaning of life and what is good for the people, all other forms of knowledge and art become idle and harmful entertainment.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: We live a senseless life, contrary to the understanding of life by the wisest people of all times. This happens because our young generations are educated in the wrong way—they are taught different sciences but they are not taught the meaning of life.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The only real science is the knowledge of how a person should live his life. And this knowledge is open to everyone.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Society can be improved only by self-sacrifice.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: There is only one law, both in your personal and social life: if you want to improve your soul, you should be ready to sacrifice it.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The improvement of man can be measured by the level of his inner freedom. The more a person becomes free from his personality, the more freedom he has.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Death and birth are two limits, and something similar is hidden behind each.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: When you think about what will happen to your soul after death, think also about what happened to your soul before your birth. If you plan to go somewhere, then you came from somewhere.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Where do we go after death? We go to where we came from. There is nothing which can be called ourselves in that land; therefore, we do not remember what has happened to us there.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: When a person leads a good life, he is happy at the present moment and he does not think what will happen after this life. If he thinks of death, he looks at how well this life is laid out, and he believes that after death everything will be as good as it is now. It is much better to believe that everything which God makes for us is good than to believe in all the pleasures of paradise.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: A person should not think too much about what will happen after his life. Follow the will of those who sent us into this world; that will is in our minds and our hearts.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The more closely a person follows his intellect and controls his passions, the closer he comes to spiritual life, to love of God and of his neighbor.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: We would think a man insane who, instead of covering his house with a roof and putting windows in his window frames, goes out in stormy weather, and scolds the wind, the rain, and the clouds. But we all do the same when we scold and blame the evil in other people instead of fighting the evil which exists in us. It is possible to get rid of the evil inside of us, as it is possible to make a roof and windows for our house. This is possible. But it is not possible for us to destroy evil in this world, just as we cannot order the weather to change and the clouds to disappear. If, instead of teaching others, we would educate and improve ourselves, then there would be less evil in this world, and all people would live better lives.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: It seems to us that the most important work in the world is the work which is visible, which we can see: building a house, plowing the land, feeding cattle, gathering fruits; and that the work which is invisible, the work done by our soul, is not important. But our invisible work at the improvement of our soul is the most important work in the world, and all other visible kinds of work are useful only when we do this major work.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: No exceptions or special circumstances can justify the murder of a living person. Murder is the most vulgar violation of the Law of God as it is expressed in all religious teachings and in all people’s conscience.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Military service makes people corrupt, because the military, in time of peace, abides in complete idleness; they lack any useful labor, they are freed of the obligations of such work. Instead, they create notions of honor of regiment, or of banner, or the complete subjugation of one person by another.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: When civilians get into these circumstances, they become ashamed of such a way of life. The military, on the contrary, are proud of it and boast of this way of life, especially during periods of war. They say: “We are ready to risk our lives at war, and therefore such a careless joyful life is necessary for us, and we have the right to lead it.”
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The same divine beginning lives in all people, and no single person or gathering of people has the right to destroy this connection between the divine beginning and a human body, that is, to take a human life.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Among all sins, there is one which completely opposes the major blessing of human life, which is your love for your brother: there is no worse sin than to destroy this major joy of life, by feeling rage and hatred for your brother.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Seneca, a wise man from Rome, said that when you want to escape from your rage, when you feel that it grows, the best thing to do is to stop. Do not do anything: do not walk, do not move, do not speak. If your body or your tongue moves at this moment, then your rage will grow.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Rage is very harmful for all people, but it is most harmful for the man who experiences it.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Your rage cannot be justified by anything. The reason for your rage is always inside you.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Nobody knows where the human race is going. The highest wisdom, then, is to know whereyoushould go: toward perfection.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Your actions should be determined not by the desire of the people around you, but by the needs of all mankind.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: There is a basic knowledge which is necessary for every human being; until a person has acquired this basic knowledge, all other kinds of knowledge will be harmful for him.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: It is better to know several basic rules of life than to study many unnecessary sciences. The major rules of life will stop you from evil and show you the good path in life; but the knowledge of many unnecessary sciences may lead you into the temptation of pride, and stop you from understanding the basic rules of life.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: A rich man cannot be merciful. If he becomes really merciful, he will quickly lose his riches.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The best example of the cruelty of the rich man’s life is his effort to become virtuous.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: In order to love not with word and tongue, but in deed and truth, everyone should help those who ask for help, so Christ said.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: But if you start giving to all those who ask, even if you are very rich, very soon you will not be rich anymore.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Love for other people gives a real feeling of good, and it unites you with other people and with God.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: A wise man loves not because he wants to profit from it but because he finds bliss in love itself.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: They asked a Chinese man, “What is science?” He said, “Science is knowing people.” Then they asked, “And what is virtue?” He answered, “Virtue is loving people.”
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Just as a mother puts her life at risk to guard and save her only child, so every person should guard and save in himself love for every living being.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The fearlessness, calm, inner peace, and joy which are given to us by love are so big that all other things in the world cannot be compared with them, especially for the person who understands the real blessing of love.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: For a person to know the law that makes him free, he must be elevated from a material to a spiritual life.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: “I and God are the same,” said the teacher. If you think that my spiritual being is God, you are mistaken. But my real self is close to God, and to other people. In order to understand this part of myself, you should elevate the man inside of you. When you elevate the man inside of you, then you will see that there is no difference between him and any other person on earth.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: It only seems as if we differ from each other. A flower on a blossoming tree can think that it is a separate being, but all flowers are parts of the same blossoming of one apple tree, and they all come from one seed.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Submission to the law created by men makes one a slave; obedience to the law created by God makes one free.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Wisdom is knowing the purpose of life, and knowing how to achieve it.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: There is nothing in which real wisdom cannot be displayed.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: When people wanted to kill a bear in the ancient times, they hung a heavy log over a bowl of honey. The bear would push the log away in order to eat the honey. The log would swing back and hit the bear. The bear would become irritated and push the log even harder, and it would return and hit him harder in return. This would continue until the log killed the bear. People behave in the same way when they return evil for the evil they receive from other people. Can’t people be wiser than bears?
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: You should respond with kindness toward evil done to you, and you will destroy in an evil person that pleasure which he derives from evil.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The true teaching of love is strong; it kills evil before evil can grow and become powerful.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Only greatly insolent people establish a religious law which is to be taken for granted by others, which should be accepted by everyone on faith, without any discussion or doubts.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Why must people do this?
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The essence of the teaching of Christ is to follow his commandments. Those who just repeat, “My God, My Lord” will not get to heaven; only those who fulfill God’s will.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: It is not possible to explain the origin of the spiritual from the material.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The difference between the spiritual realm and the material is equally clear and obvious, both for a child and a wise man; further speculations are not necessary.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: There are two different states of human existence: first, to live without thinking of death; second, to live with the thought that you approach death with every hour of your life.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The more you transform your life from the material to the spiritual domain, the less you become afraid of death. A person who lives a truly spiritual life has no fear of death.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: When you have doubts about what to do, just imagine that you might die at the end of that same day, and then all your doubts will disappear, and you will see clearly what your conscience tells you, and what is your true personal wish.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: A man condemned to immediate execution will not think about the growth of his estate, or about achieving glory, or about the victory of one group over another, or about the discovery of a new planet. But one minute before his death a man may wish to console an abused person, or help an old person to stand up, or to put a bandage on someone’s injury, or to repair a toy for a child.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Kindness is for your soul as health is for your body: you do not notice it when you have it.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Love is real only when a person can sacrifice himself for another person. Only when a person forgets himself for the sake of another, and lives for another creature, only this kind of love can be called true love, and only in this love do we see the blessing and reward of life. This is the foundation of the world.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Nothing can make our life, or the lives of other people, more beautiful than perpetual kindness.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: A man is free only when he lives in truth, and the truth may be perceived only by the intellect.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: We are not free in this world, subdued by our passions and by the emotions of other people to the degree that we forget the requirements of our intellects. If we really want to become free, we can be so only through our intellect.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: All events, whether in the lives of human individuals, or human societies, have their beginnings in thought. Therefore, to fully understand other people and other societies, we must look beyond previous events to the thoughts which gave rise to them.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Perhaps it is even more important to know what one should not think about than what one should think about.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: A thought seems to be free and independent, but a human being has something stronger than thought, something which could guide our thoughts.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: In order to change the nature of things, either within yourself or in others, one should change, not the events, but those thoughts which created those events.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Sexual desire is the most all-consuming of desires. This desire is never sated, for the more it is satisfied, the more it grows.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Very often people are made proud by their control over their own desires, and by the force and passion with which they master them. What a strange delusion!
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Many people worry, and suffer, because they have been involved in so many bad things in their lives. In truth, though, good things often happen in spite of our wishes, and sometimes even in opposition to our wishes, and often after our excitement and suffering over unworthy things.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Remember how passionately you yearned in the past for many of the things which you hate or despise now.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Remember how many things you lost trying to satisfy your former desires. The same thing could happen now, with the desires which excite you at present. Try to tame your present desires, calm them; this is most beneficial, and most achievable.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Perfecting the self is both an inner and an outer work: You cannot improve yourself without communicating with other people, influencing them, and being influenced by them.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: “Be perfect, as your heavenly Father,” Christ said. This does not mean that Christ asked people to be as good as God; only that everyone should strive for perfection.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: There is nothing more harmful to you than improving only your material, animal side of life. There is nothing more beneficial, both for you and for others, than activity directed to the improvement of your soul.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Why do people like to blame others so much? He who casts blame on another person is quick to think that he would not do the very same thing. It is the same with people who like to listen to the fault-finding of their neighbors.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: When two people have a dispute, both are to blame. And therefore, a dispute will stop only when at least one person understands that he or she is guilty.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Stop blaming other people, and you will feel what an alcoholic feels when he stops drinking, or what a smoker feels when he stops smoking. You will feel that you have brought relief to your soul.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The material evil caused by war is big, but it is incomparably small in comparison with the perversion or the understanding of good and bad which happens during the war, and which is put into the souls of people who do not think.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: A child meets another child with a smile, displaying his friendly attitude and joy. This same behavior lives in all sincere people. But very often, a man from one nation already hates a man from another nation, and is ready to cause him sufferings and even death, even before he meets him. Those who create these feelings in nations commit a terrible crime!
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: War creates a state in which power and glory is at the end too often received by the most undeserving and vicious people.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The higher the opinion a person has of himself, the more unstable is his position; the lower he moves in his selfesteem, the firmer he stands.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Try to find out your potential. After you know it, do not be afraid to underestimate it. Be cautious not to exaggerate it.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: A person’s life is good only to the extent that it fulfills the expectations of the will of God.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Evil, in the form of suffering and death, is everywhere apparent to a person who accepts the law of his material, animal existence as the major law of his life. Only when a man lowers himself to the state of an animal does death and suffering scare him. The only road open for him to escape that fear is the road of fulfillment of the law of God, the law which is expressed in love. There is no death and no suffering for a man who lives according to the law of God.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: We know the law of God, both as it is presented to us by the different religions of the world and as our own conscience, when it is not obscured by passion and prejudice, and we can easily understand the applications of this law to our life, for all real good stems from its requirements.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: It is obvious for everyone that death expects us all in the long run; but nevertheless we live our lives as if there will be no death.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The more deeply you understand life, the less you grieve over the destruction caused by death.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Religion is a philosophy which can be understood by anyone.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Religion is simple wisdom which is directed to the heart and understood by the intellect.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Religion can enlighten philosophical meditations; philosophical meditations can strengthen religion. Therefore, try to communicate both with truly religious people and truly good philosophers, alive and dead.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: A holy spirit lives within you.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: God lives in every one of us. When a person remembers this, the thought of it can save him from evil, and help him to do good.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: There is simplicity of nature, and there is simplicity of wisdom. Both of them evoke love and respect.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The greatest truth is the most simple one.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: When people speak in a very elaborate and sophisticated way, they either want to tell a lie, or to admire themselves. You should not believe such people. Good speech is always clear, clever, and understood by all.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Words can unite people. Therefore, try to speak very clearly, and tell only the truth, for nothing can unite people more than truth and simplicity.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The younger and the more primitive a person is, the more he or she believes that life is material and that it exists only in the body. The older and wiser a person becomes, the more he or she understands that all life originates from the spirit.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: A person can understand his real destination in life only after he manages to liberate himself from the sensual, material world.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: All people of the world have an equal right to the privileges of this world.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Equality cannot be reached, as some people think, only by civil measures. It can be reached only by love of God and people, and this love can be reached, not by civil measures, but only as the result of spiritual learning.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: They say that equality is not possible, because some people will always be stronger or smarter than others. But it is exactly because of this, said Lichtenberg, precisely because some people are stronger and smarter than others, that the principle of equality is necessary. The advantages of the rich over the poor demonstrate not only inequality of force and intellect, but inequality of civil rights.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Christ revealed to humanity those things which their best selves already knew: that people are equal because the same spirit lives in all of them…. Learn from the small children, behave like children, and treat all people on an equal basis, with love and tenderness.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Personality is a mask which disguises the divine being which lives in every person. The more one rejects personality, the more this divine beginning is manifested.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Only when we forget about ourselves, when we get out of the thoughts of ourselves, can we fruitfully communicate with others, listen to them, and influence them.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: It is a sin not to be engaged in work, even if it is not necessary for you to make your living with everyday work.
author: Leo Tolstoy
