We cannot perceive this compass until we stray from goodness, but as soon as we do something bad, then we feel this pull away from the direction of goodness in life.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Fear all that is not accepted by your conscience.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: In our time, the killing of animals for pleasure or food is almost a crime, and hunting and eating meat are not just trivial things, but bad actions, which like any other bad actions lead to many other actions which are worse.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The misery of the unintellectual life brings us to the need for an intellectual life.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Before, I lived in sin, and I saw that the majority of people around me lived in the same way. Like a robber, I knew I was unhappy and I suffered, and that people around me were unhappy and they suffered; and I didn’t see any way out of this situation except for suicide or death. Life seemed terrible to me. And then I heard the words of Christ and I understood them. And life ceased to seem an evil, and instead of desperation I felt a happiness for life which surpasses even death.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: When you suffer, think not on how you can escape suffering, but concentrate your efforts on what kind of inner moral and spiritual perfection this suffering requires.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: All the misfortunes of mankind collectively and individually are not useless; they bring people and individuals and nations in different ways closer to the purpose which is set before them: the appearance of God, for every person in himself, and in all mankind.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: There is only one true religion for all of mankind.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: We can believe in a thing, we can know that it exists, even if we cannot understand it with our intellect, or explain it with words.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Do not fear hesitations but study the different faiths and religions intellectually.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Only he who accepts that the essence or meaning of his life is not material but spiritual can be free.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: A slave who is happy with his state is a slave twice over, because not only his body but his soul is enslaved.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: There is no middle way: either be a slave of people or of God.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Understanding or mindfulness of death teaches one to choose the things which are complete or could be completed; and those things are the most important.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: There is no death for the spirit; therefore, a person who lives a spiritual life is freed from death.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Whenever you ask whether you should behave in this way or the other, ask yourself, what would you do if you knew that you could die this evening, and nobody would find out about your action? Death spurs people to finish their affairs; among all actions, there is only one type which is complete, and that is love which seeks no reward.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: It is very useful to notice the impression which our life and deeds make upon other people.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Never try to justify your deeds.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Love provides a person with the purpose of his life. Intellect shows him the means to achieve that purpose.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: If a person lacks intellect, he can not distinguish bad from good, and so he can neither truly seek nor truly have real goodness.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: A good life is given only to those who make efforts to achieve it.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: In order to have a good life, you should not be afraid of any good deeds. You should have no less power or strength for small acts than for the biggest and greatest good deed.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Try to live a good life in accord with the virtues that are set before you. Perhaps this is a difficult thing, but with time it becomes more and more joyful.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: If you need goodness, follow God’s law. And to follow the law of God is possible only by making an effort. Not only is this effort rewarded with a happy life, but even the effort itself gives the biggest blessing of life.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The family relationship is only good and firm and giving of virtue to people when it goes beyond family and is also religious, and all the members of the family believe in one God and His law. Otherwise, the family is the source not of pleasure but of suffering.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: One of the most common explanations for bad deeds is the family name. People steal, make bribes, do many other nasty things in life, all of which can be explained by their love for their family.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Family love is a selfish feeling, and therefore it can justify bad, unworthy actions.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: In family love, in the moral high meaning, there is nothing good or bad, just as in self-love. Both are natural. Love of your family, as well as of yourself, when it surpasses its limits, can be a vice, but it can never be a virtue, because it’s a natural feeling.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Depression is a state of the soul in which you can see no sense either in your own life or in the life of the world. This state is not only painful for the people around you, but it can influence them, and a truly good person deals with this unpleasantness when he is alone. When you have bad spirits or are in a low mood, or you are irritated, you should be so in solitude.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: When everything you see appears in dark, gloomy shades, and seems baleful, and you want to tell others only bad and unpleasant things, do not trust your perceptions. Treat yourself as though you were drunk. Take no steps and actions until this state has disappeared.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: You should never feel depressed.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: A man should always feel happy; if he is unhappy, it means he is guilty.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: O Lord, help me to be always happy and to rejoice following and fulfilling your will.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Both our physical sufferings and periods of depression are part of our life in this world, and we should patiently wait until they are over, or our life is over.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: As soon as a person asks himself the question, “How do I live my life in the best way?” then all other questions are answered.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Real living takes place not in the domain of outward change, but in the inner domain, where changes can hardly be observed, in our spiritual life.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The more people believe that others can improve their lives, the slower any improvement will occur.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The human soul is divine.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Life is given to us in the same way as a child is given to a nanny, so that it can be raised to maturity.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Keep yourself in purity, far from evil, so that divine power may come through you. And in this flow of divine power through you, there is great bliss.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: There is no other domain where the words of our language are so misused as in the criticism of art, especially of false art.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: There are two very clear indications of real science and real art: the first inner sign is that a scholar or an artist works not for profit, but for sacrifice, for his calling; the second, outer sign is that his works are understandable to all people. Real science studies and makes accessible that knowledge which people at that period of history think important, and real art transfers this truth from the domain of knowledge to the domain of feelings.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Creating art is not as elevated a thing as many people guess, but certainly it is a useful and kind thing to do, especially if it brings people together and arouses kind feelings in them.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: A person is enslaved to the extent he believes that his life has only a physical beginning.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: If you feel that you are not free, look for the reason inside you.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Punishment is a notion that humankind gradually outgrows.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: A person has done evil, so another person, or a group of people, in order to fight this evil, cannot think of anything better than to create another evil, which they call punishment.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Every punishment is based, not on logic or on the feeling of justice, but on the desire to wish evil on those who have done evil to you or to another person.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Capital punishment is a very clear proof that our society’s organization is far from being a Christian one.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Everything about our present system of punishments and about all criminal law will be thought of by future generations in the same way that we think of cannibalism or human sacrifice to ancient pagan gods. “How did they not see the uselessness and cruelty of those things which they did?” our descendants will say about us.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: To punish others is like putting more wood in the fire. Every crime already has punishment in itself, and it is more cruel and more just than the punishment created by people.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: We should remember that the desire to punish is part of a very low animal feeling which should be suppressed, and which should not be a part of our reality.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Follow the best way of life you possibly can, and habit will make this way suitable and pleasant for you.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Everything is from God; therefore, everything is good. Evil is goodness which we did not understand because of our shortsightedness.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: When one understands that kind of evil which is in his deeds, then all other misfortunes to which he can be subjected are nothing as compared with the pleasure and freedom he can then experience.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Neither the descriptions of war nor its terrible cruelties and atrocities can stop people from participating in it. One reason for this is that by viewing the atrocities of war, everyone comes to understand that if such a terrible thing can exist and be accepted by people, then there must be some reason for its existence.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The time has come to talk about the evils of war. It is not true that the existence of wars proves their necessity. The history of mankind says that such things should not happen.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: To deny God is to deny yourself as a spiritual and intellectual being.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: I know God and soul not by their definition, but in another way entirely. Striving to define God destroys this knowledge in me. I know that God exists, that my soul exists; this knowledge is clear to me because I was given it. I have not the slightest doubt about the existence of God, if I ask: What am I? Who am I? My legs are not me; my arms are not me; my head is not me; my feelings are not me; even my thought is not me. Then what am I? I am myself, I am my soul. No matter which side I approach this question, I inevitably come to God. The beginning of my life is God, the beginning of my existence is God. The same with the soul. If I want to know the truth, I know that at the beginning of all is my soul; if I want to understand my feeling of love and necessity for goodness, then I again find the source of this in my soul.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Life in this world goes according to somebody’s will—someone performs special actions upon all life in this world, and touches all our lives. That which performs these actions is what we call God.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: That feeling which solves all of the contradictions of human life and gives one the greatest bliss is known to all people: this feeling is love.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Love destroys death and makes it empty; it gives meaning to senseless things; from unhappiness, love makes real happiness.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The less love a person has, the more he suffers.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: If you are in a difficult situation, a low mood, if you are afraid of other people and of yourself, if you are tormented, then tell yourself: “I will love everyone whom I meet in this life.” Try to follow this rule; and you will see that everything will find its way, and everything will seem simple, and you will no longer have doubts or fears.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: People mistakenly think that virtue lies in the knowledge of many things. What is important is not the quantity but the quality of knowledge.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Do not fear the lack of knowledge, fear false knowledge. All evil in this world comes from false knowledge.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Knowledge born in argument and discussion is to be doubted.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: In the world today, real faith has in most cases been replaced by public opinion. People do not believe in God, but they believe in many minor things which are taught by other people.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: People’s misfortunes are caused not because they do not know their duties, but because they misunderstand their duties.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Faith is not achieved by a majority of votes.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The major reason for the evil that exists today is the absence of faith in people of our time.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Truly virtuous is the person who gives his love to the weak.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: If a rich person could be truly virtuous, then he would stop being rich very quickly.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The foundation of love is in each person’s understanding of the unity of the divine spark which lives in all people.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: All that brings unification to people is goodness and beauty; all that brings separation among them is evil. All people know this: it is firmly inscribed on our hearts.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: We are separate beings, it seems, but in our inner life we are closely connected with all living things.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: We can feel some of the vibrations of this spiritual world; some of them have not reached us yet, but they are moving, as the vibrations of light from the distant stars are moving across the universe; they move, though they are not yet visible to our eyes.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The existing order of things can he improved.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: In order to fulfill the law of God as we understand it, a joint effort must be made by many people. Then, maybe slowly, we will move to an understanding of this divine law.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: God’s kingdom is the fulfillment among mankind of God’s will, according to the measure in which it is revealed to us.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: In the life of the world, thousands of years look like one year. Therefore, we should work hard at the fulfillment of eternity, and we should wait for the day when religion will enlighten this world completely.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The kingdom of God is inside us; therefore look for the kingdom of God inside you and the rest will take care of itself, in the best possible way.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: My material life is subject to suffering and death, and no effort of mine can release me from suffering or death. My spiritual life is subject neither to suffering nor death. Therefore, salvation from suffering and death lies in only one thing: in the transfer of my conscious “self” from the material to the spiritual.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The way to understand this world is to understand your inner self. With the help of love, and by virtue of the love of others, we understand other beings: people, animals, plants, stones, heavenly bodies; and we understand the attitudes of these beings to themselves; and these attitudes create the whole world as we know it. The way to understanding is based on love, on unification with all other creatures in the world.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: That which we understand as the happiness or unhappiness of our animal “self” depends on the highest spiritual will.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Nothing can support idleness better than empty chatter. People would be better to keep silent and not speak the boring, empty things they routinely say to entertain themselves. How can they endure it?
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Those people speak most who do not have much to say.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The less you speak, the more you will work.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The foundation of ancient societies was violence. The basis of our contemporary society is wise concord, the negation of violence.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Some people think that it is impossible to rule other people without violence. And so they do to people as other people do with horses, when they blind their eyes so that they will more obediently walk in a circle.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: For what purpose is a man’s intellect if you are going to influence him only with violence?
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: In all cases, when people use violence, you should try to convince them not to. You should try to apply wise, convincing arguments, appealing not to the everyday world, but to their higher spiritual understanding. Then, when you succeed, you will have the complete satisfaction of your conscience.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: People believe in eternal life because they believe that life’s beginning is spiritual, and therefore eternal.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: A person is not afraid to die only after he understands that he was never born, that he always existed, exists at present, and will always exist.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: A person will believe in his eternity when he understands that his life is not a wave, a period of time, but the eternal movement which is manifested in this life only as a wave.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Those who believe that their life has not begun with their birth and will not end with death find it much easier to live a good life than those who do not understand or believe this.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Really true, good, and great things are always simple.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Very often the simplest and least educated people can easily and unconsciously understand the meaning of life while the most scholarly people lack this ability, because they have been too educated to understand the simple things that are basic to all people.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: If you want to find an example to follow, you should look among simple, humble folk. There is real greatness only in those who do not advertise themselves, and who do not understand themselves as great.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The feeling of compassion for other living beings reminds me of the feeling of pain in our body. Just as you can become less sensitive to pain in your body with time, you can become less compassionate to others.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: When the suffering of another creature causes you to feel pain, do not submit to the initial desire to flee from the suffering one, but on the contrary, come closer, as close as you can to him who suffers, and try to help him.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Love is the manifestation of the divine nature which exists above time. Love is not only a way of life, it is an action directed toward the goodness of others.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: There is no love in the future. Love can exist only in the present moment. A man who does not manifest love in the present does not love at all.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Be kind even if the world blames you. It is better than the converse when a person is praised by others but continues to be bad.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Certainly, it is painful to recall all the things which you could have done in the past but did not: some charity, for example; a time you denied to those who expected help from you; or when you blocked the joyful understanding of completing an action you should have finished.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Faith is not true faith if love is not in harmony with it.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: If a person is not in a hurry to fulfill the things which he understands as the law of God, then he believes neither in the law, nor in God.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Effort is the necessary condition of moral perfection.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Those who think that they can live a high spiritual life whose bodies are filled with idleness and luxuries are mistaken.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: If you were abused, make an effort to love those who have abused you. If you have abused someone, make an effort to correct the evil which you created.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: When one understands life’s law, one manifests the part of God which lives inside him.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: In the long run, people achieve only that which they have set as goals for themselves; therefore, set the highest possible goals for yourself.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The fulfillment of the law of goodness has nothing in common with everyday material prosperity. Sometimes material prosperity and moral goodness clash in conflict. These sufferings lead to the highest elevation of spirit.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Sometimes we cannot see any connection between our suffering and our sin, but this connection definitely exists.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: “I was repaid with evil for the goodness which I have done.” But if you love those for whom you did good, then you have already received your reward. Therefore, all that you do with love, you do for yourself.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Look for the causes of the evil from which you suffer in yourself. Sometimes this evil is the direct consequence of your activity; sometimes it happens after a lengthy period of transformation of an evil which you committed long ago. But the source is always in you, and salvation from it lies in changes in your actions, your way of life.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: In every faith, only what is spiritual is true.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: If you do not believe that at its beginning, your life came from spirit, why are you looking for it elsewhere, thinking that you can find spirit in other places? He who behaves in this way is like the man who burns a lantern in bright sunlight.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Do not be afraid to get rid of things which distract your attention—everything material, everything which can be seen or can be felt. The more you purify the spiritual core of your faith, the firmer your faith will be.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Knowledge is a tool, not a purpose.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: People know little, because they try to understand those things which are not open to them for understanding: God, eternity, spirit; or those which are not worth thinking about: how water becomes frozen, or a new theory of numbers, or how viruses can transmit illnesses. How to live your life is the only real knowledge.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: People who think that the most important thing in life is knowledge remind me of a butterfly who flies into the flame of a candle, and in so doing burns, and extinguishes the light.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The purpose of life is the fulfillment of the law of God, not the acquisition of ever more knowledge.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Repentance always precedes perfection. It is sad that people think repentance is unnecessary.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Not to accept your mistakes is to increase them.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: You should live in such a way that you can confide anything on your mind.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The more important something is in your life, the more harmful it can be for you in the future if you abuse it. The misfortunes and woes of people often come from the abuse of the most precious tool of our life: intellect.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: God gave his spirit, his intellect, to us, so that we can understand his will and fulfill it; but we misuse it and apply this spirit for the fulfillment of our own will.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: When a person tries to apply his intellect to the question “Why do I exist in this world?” he becomes dizzy. The human intellect cannot find the answers to such questions. What does this mean? This means that our intellect is not given to us to find a solution for this question. Our intellect can only answer the question: “How shall I live?” And the answer is simple: “We should live so as to bring good to all people.”
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The purpose of the intellect is to reveal the truth; therefore it is a harmful misconception to pervert the truth with intellectual efforts.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Only those who know their weaknesses can be tolerant of the weaknesses of their neighbors.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Almost always, when we look deep into our souls, we can find there the same sins which we blame in others. If we do not find a particular sin in our soul, then we should look more closely, and we will find even worse sins there.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: If we can put ourselves into the place of other people, we lessen our pride.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: If Christians would follow the law, there would be no rich and no poor.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Wealth reminds me of manure in the field. When it is in a big pile it makes a bad smell. But when it is distributed everywhere across the field, it makes the soil fertile.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: A person must completely close his eyes on his morals, that in a Christian society so filled with people in need, there are other people who are so proud to have great wealth.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The intellect can liberate a person; the less of an intellectual life one has, the less liberated one is.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: A wise person lives in accordance with his desires, because he wants only that which is attainable. Such a person is free.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: We have created a way of life which is contrary to mankind’s moral and physical nature, and yet we want to be free while living this kind of life.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Freedom cannot be achieved by looking for it, but in looking for truth. Freedom should not be a purpose, but a consequence.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Freedom cannot be granted to you by others. Each person can liberate only himelf.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: If you are a material being, then death is the end of everything. But if you are a spiritual being, then the body limits your spiritual being, and death is only a change.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Our body limits the spiritual divine spark which we call our soul. In the way that a vessel gives form to the liquid or gas which is put into it, our body gives form to our spiritual being. If the vessel is broken, that which was in it no longer retains the form it had and flows out. Does it receive a new form? Is it united with other beings? We know nothing of this. After death the soul becomes something different, something indescribable.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Death is a liberation of the soul from the material personality in which it existed in this world.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: For those who live a spiritual life, there is no death.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: We expect rewards for goodness, and punishments for the bad things which we do. Often, they are not immediately forthcoming. Both evil and good exist in the life of the spirit, though, which is outside time, and though we may not see clear indications of reward or punishment, nevertheless, we feel reward or punishment with our conscience.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The worst punishment is the understanding that you failed to properly use those good things which were given to you. Do not expect a big punishment. There can be no harder punishment than this remorse.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Doing good is the only sure path to bliss.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Do not expect some tangible reward for your goodness; your actions are their own reward. In the same way, do not think that you can hope to avoid punishment of your evil acts, for your punishment already lies in your soul. You are mistaken if you think that the pain in your soul was caused by anything else.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Self-abnegation is not the rejection of your entire self, just the rejection of your animal being.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The greatest bliss a person can know is the state of complete freedom and happiness that can come only through self-sacrifice and love.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Deny your personality, and you will come to understand the highest good in life: love.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The more a person gives to other people, and the less he asks for himself, the better for him. The less he gives to others, and the more he wants for himself, the worse for him. Our contemporaries think it the reverse.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: For the most part, false and harmful opinions are distributed and supported by influence. We are too likely to accept the views and thoughts of other people without trying to investigate them deeper and further ourselves. Unimportant people are those who accept other people’s thoughts without developing them themselves.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Your thought is easily influenced by the presence of another soul; a person can be completely free only when he is alone.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Nothing is more harmful than a bad example set by others. They bring into our life notions which never would have occurred to us without an example.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: A person can easily grow accustomed to living a lie, especially if he sees everyone around him living in the same way.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: False ideas which gain currency can easily be recognized by the loud fanfare with which they are accompanied. Real truth does not need any outer embellishments.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The possibility of influencing others causes a person with high morals to be more strict about his words and actions which could influence other people.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The intellect is the only fit guide for human life.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: A man who lives an intellectual life is like a man who carries a lantern in front of him to light his way. Such a person will never come to a dark place, because the light of his intellect moves before him. There is no fear of death in this kind of life, because the lantern which moves before you lights your way to your last minute, and you follow it to the end as calmly and quietly as you have all of your life.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Some people live and act according to their own thoughts, and some according to the thoughts of others; this is a crucial distinction between people.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Vanity has no limits.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: You could choose no worse way to guide your life than to follow the opinions of other people.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: It’s not wise to be interested in fame and the appreciation of others, because no two people’s opinions about what is good are the same.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The opinion of a revered writer or thinker can have a deep influence on society; it can also be a big obstacle to understanding real truth.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Divine truth may be revealed in the speech of children, or in the ravings and nightmares of madmen; or in the ordinary conversations of simple people. And weak and false thoughts may be found in books which have come to be considered great, or even sacred.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Many statements which are accepted as truth because they have been passed down to us by tradition look like truth only because we have never tested them, never thought about them in a more precise way.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: A thought which is expressed in the Old Testament, or in the New Testament, or in the Koran or in the Indian divine book the Upanishads, does not become a truth because it is expressed in a book which is considered to be holy. If we think that every word in every holy book is true, then we have created an idol.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Any important thought, no matter where it comes from, should be discussed; and every thought, no matter who said it, should be given attention.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The majority of evils people commit are the result, not of an evil will, but of the dissemination of evil thoughts which people accept and follow uncritically.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Think only good thoughts, and with time they will become good deeds.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Thoughts which create evil actions are much worse than the acts themselves. You can stop doing a bad thing, and repent, and not repeat it. But bad thoughts are repeated again and again, and cause other bad actions; bad thoughts follow one after another.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Think good thoughts, and your thoughts will be turned into good actions. Everything begins in thought. Guiding your thoughts is one of the keys to self-perfection. If you suffer misfortunes in your life, look for their cause, not in your actions, but in the thoughts which inspired them, and try to improve those thoughts. If you are inspired by an event in your life, look for its origins in your previous thoughts which caused the event.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: You make your decisions in the present, and the present exists out of time; it is a tiny moment where two periods—the past and the future—meet. In the present you are always free to make your choice.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: A wise man was asked what was the most important time, person, and thing in life. He answered, “The most important time is the present time, because at this time a person has power over himself. The most important person is the one with whom you deal at present, because there is no guarantee that you will ever be able to deal with any other person in this world. The most important thing is to love this person, because everyone is sent into this world with the sole purpose of loving other people.”
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: A most dangerous temptation is the temptation to prepare to live, instead of living. The future does not belong to you. Therefore, remember to live the best way you knownow. The only perfection necessary is perfection in love, which can be reached only in the present. It’s why we came into this world.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The present is the moment in which the divine nature of life is revealed. Let us respect our present time; God exists in this time.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: A person dies as he lives his spiritual life, alone.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: A person may ask God or other people for help, but only his good life can help him, and this he must do on his own.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Every person has a depth to his inner life, an essence that cannot be explained. Sometimes you want to explain this essence to people, but you will see that it isn’t possible to explain it to another person so that he understands.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Hence the need for your own channel of communication with God. Establish this channel and do not seek anything else.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The burden, the cross, which every man has to carry exists on two planes: a longer vertical plane, which is the will of God; and a much shorter, horizontal plane, which is a man’s own will. If you orient your will so that it parallels the direction of God’s will, then you will have no cross to carry, no burden.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: If you want to fulfill the will of God, all will be good; if you want to fulfill your own will, and it does not coincide with the will of God, all will be evil.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The only way to know God and to believe in eternity is to unite your own will with the will of God.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: To be wise, you must follow your intellect, even though such a way of life is often attacked.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: You should not be upset by the sight of wisdom being criticized. Wisdom would not be real wisdom if it did not reveal the stupidity of a bad life, and people would not be people if they endured this revelation without criticism.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: People have become too accustomed to the use of force. Life without violence seems impossible for them to imagine.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: People are wise beings; they possess the ability to live according to the dictates of their intellect, and sooner or later, they will evolve from a state of violence to a state of complete harmony and understanding. And every act of violence makes this time more distant from today.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: All other arguments against meat eating, no matter how strong they are, are meaningless in relation to the fact that animals have the same life spirit that exists in us.We should feel that by taking an animal life we commit something close to suicide. No other argument against meat eating is necessary for those who have this inner feeling.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: We cannot close our eyes to those people who eat meat for the satisfaction of their pampered tastes.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The logical arguments against meat eating are not strong enough. Logic is good, but in some cases it falls short. But know this: the more compassion a person shows other living creatures, the kinder and better he is. To kill animals, whether for sport or for fuel, is very cruel.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: We are spiritually connected on all sides, not only with people but with all living creatures.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Try to understand the unity of all living things. Try to serve and suffer with all living beings.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Kindness is a necessary addition to everything.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: All the best qualities of mankind are meaningless and worthless without kindness, and even the worst vices can be easily forgiven with kindness.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: There is a natural kindness which comes from our external attributes, from our inheritance, audience, good or bad indigestion, success, etc. This kind of kindness is very pleasant, both for the person who experiences it and for the people around him. And there is another type of kindness which comes from inner, spiritual work. This kindness is less attractive, but although the first kindness can easily change or be transformed into hatred, the second kind of kindness will never disappear and will constantly grow.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Kindness is the major quality of the soul. If a person is not kind, it is because he was subjected to some lie, passion, or temptation which violated his natural state.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Christianity is true because it can answer the most distant, abstract questions, and at the same time, it can solve all practical issues of life as well. It established the kingdom of God in the spiritual life of every individual, and in the spiritual life of humanity in general.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Only religion destroys egoism and selfishness, so that one starts to live life not only for himself. Only religion destroys the fear of death, only religion gives us the meaning of life, only religion creates equality among people, only religion sets a person free from outer pressures. We must believe those spiritual doctrines which provide a very simple and practical guide for every one of us.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Life is constant movement, and therefore goodness in life is not a certain state, but the direction of movement. This direction is not in serving yourself, but God.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Happiness is a thing which a person wishes only for himself; goodness is a thing which a person wishes for himself and for others. Happiness can be achieved by struggle; goodness, on the contrary, by being humble.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Real goodness is to serve God.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: You should do goodness without choosing to whom. Good things, once done, will never disappear, even if you forget about them. There is only one way to be happy, and this is a sure way: to do goodness and to share this goodness with others.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Anyone who is engaged in really important things is very simple because he does not have time to create unnecessary things.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: People can live without need and without jealousy only when they lead a life of moderation.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: A fruitful prayer is the establishment in your conscious mind of the understanding of life’s meaning, and you can experience this state during the best minutes of your life.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: One hour of honest, serious thinking is more precious than weeks spent in empty talks.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: You should pray every hour. The most necessary and the most difficult form of prayer is to remember—in spite of the numerous distractions of life—your obligations to God, to his law. You become scared, you become upset, you become embarrassed, you become too involved or distracted by something. But you should always remember who you are and what you should do. This is what a real prayer should be about. This is difficult in the beginning, but with time you can work and create this habit.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: It is dangerous to disseminate the idea that our life is purely the product of material forces and that it depends entirely on these forces.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: There are no people who can more confuse the notions of good and evil than the scholars of our time. Their science makes good progress in the study of the material world, but in the inner, spiritual life of humanity, it becomes an unnecessary and sometimes harmful thing.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The teaching about your inner life is the most useful one.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: In our time science has started to give diplomas for idleness.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The real purpose of science is the understanding of the truth of this life. Its false purpose is the justification of evil in this world. These are the judicial sciences, political sciences, and especially theology, the science of religion.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: If people were completely virtuous, they would never step aside from the truth.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The truth is harmful only to evildoers. Those who do good love the truth.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: People move, inconspicuously but ceaselessly, toward the kingdom of God, which will be achieved by unification in love.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The constant struggle between flesh and spirit will never be finished. This struggle is eternal and the essence of life. The purpose of life is loving, the penetration of everything with love. It is the slow and gradual change from evil to good, it is the creation of the real life, the life filled with love.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The human world is always on the way to perfection, and the understanding of this process of perfection is one of mankind’s biggest joys, and this joy is accessible to every person.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Work is the condition of existence in the material, physical world. If Robinson had not worked, he would have frozen to death and died from hunger, and everybody can see this. So labor is the necessary condition for the spiritual life as well, but not all people can see this clearly, though it is as obvious as the necessity of physical labor for the body.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: If you are doing nothing, it means you are doing bad things.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Those who do nothing, do bad things. Those who do nothing, have many associates and supporters. The brain of a lazy and idle person is the favorite stopping place of the devil.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: You should never be ashamed of any work, even the lowest and dirtiest, but you should be ashamed only of the dirtiest moral state, that is the idleness of your body, which is the necessary result of the consumption of the labor of others.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Justice is achieved not in striving for justice, but with love.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: In order to hit the mark, you should aim farther than it stands, so you will achieve it; in order to be just, you should make a self-sacrifice, be unjust to yourself.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Not a single person can be completely just in all his deeds, but a just person can be completely different from an unjust one with his efforts, in the same way as a truthful man is different from a liar, with his efforts to speak only truth.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: You cannot be completely just. One time you do too little, the other time you do too much. There is only one way not to sin against justice; always to change things, to improve things, to make them better.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The best and the most important object for every person is his inner self, his spiritual being.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: A person who knows all sciences but does not know himself is a poor and ignorant person. He who does not know anything except for his inner spiritual self is an enlightened person.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: A person always has a place to be safe from all of his misfortunes, and this place is his soul.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: If you could only know who you are, all your troubles would seem utterly unnecessary and trivial.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Faith is the foundation on which all else rests; it is the root of all knowledge.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: There are two types of faith in this world. The first is faith in things other people say, faith in people; there are many varieties of this type of faith. The second is faith in God; this type of faith is unvarying, and it is necessary for all people.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Faith is the necessary property of the soul. Feel the essential meaninglessness of those things which are well-known to you, and the greatness of things which are unknown but important.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Cleave to the teachings of Christ completely, and let go of other teachings, just as a sailor reads his compass, though other signs around him might contradict it.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: People who believe they do not have faith are wrong; they simply don’t realize it, or don’t want it, or cannot express it.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: If, in his soul, a person understands God, he understands his connection to all the world’s people.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: We are all children of the same father, and it is unnatural not to love our brothers.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Those who are on top of the mountain can see the sunrise sooner than those who live in the valley. So, too, with those who achieve spiritual heights: they can see the heavenly sunrise sooner than those who live a material life. But the time will come when the sun will rise so high in the sky that everyone will see it.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: As soon as the higher ideal is put before us, all false ideals will fade away as the stars fade away when they meet the sun.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Any work of false art praised by critics is a door through which “hypocrites of art” enter our minds.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The creation and sale of most art today is pure prostitution. The comparison is true in every detail. Real art can only rarely be created even by a real artist; like a child in a mother’s womb, it is the ripened fruit of his prior life. False art, though, can be ceaselessly produced by craftsmen, according to the dictates of a market. Like a faithful wife who loves her husband, real art does not need any excess decoration; like a prostitute, false art demands to be decorated. True art comes out of an artist’s urgent need to express the feelings that have formed inside him, just as a mother needs to give birth to her baby. False art answers only to profit. Real art brings new feelings into our life, as a woman brings a new person into the world. False art corrupts: it makes a person dissipated, distracts him, weakens his spiritual power. Everyone must understand this, in order that they shun the terrible proliferation of this dirty, dissipated type of art which is, on its face, prostitution.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Until they throw the money changers out of the temple of art, it will never be a real temple. But the time will come when these salesmen will be sent away from the temple of art.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Soldiers who stand idle in a shelter during a battle as reinforcements will try to involve themselves in almost any activity in order to distract themselves from the impending danger. It seems to me that people who want to save themselves from life behave like these soldiers: some distract themselves with vanity, some with cards, politics, laws, women, gambling, horses, hunting, wine, or state affairs.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: It is difficult to imagine what wonderful changes would occur to human lives if people would stop poisoning themselves with brandy, wine, tobacco, and drugs.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: They say that there is one religious sect that at the end of their gatherings they turn down the lights and have an orgy. In our society, people who participate in constant dissipations turn down the light of the intellect with addictive things such as drugs, alcohol, and tobacco.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Making yourself addicted is not a crime, but it is a preparation for crime.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Some people say, “It is not important if you drink or smoke.” If it is of no importance, then why not just stop, if you know that you harm yourself and, with your example, others?
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The closer people are to the truth, the more tolerant they are of the mistakes of others.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Those who don’t believe in the spiritual foundations of their faith, who only pay lip service to the outer shell of their religious rituals, cannot be tolerant of others.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: There is one hard and fast rule we must always remember: if a good end can be achieved only through bad means, either it is not good after all, or its time has not yet come.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: A real truth, a real faith, needs neither worldly support nor an outer glamour, nor does it need to be forcefully introduced to others. God has time; for Him thousands of years pass as one. Those who feel the need to spread their faith through violence and force either lack faith in God, or in themselves.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: God cannot be understood by the human intellect, only felt by the human heart. We only know that he exists, and regardless of whether we want it or not, we know this for sure.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The intellect is like a light that comes through a translucent glass: I see it, and though I do not know where it comes from, I know that it exists. We can say the same about God.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: We can understand the existence of God with our intellect only when we understand our complete dependence on him, as if we have the same feeling an infant understands when his mother holds him. A baby does not know who feeds him, who warms him, who takes care of him, but he understands that thereissomeone who does this, and even he loves the force in whose power he rests.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Do not be alarmed if the notion of God is not clearly expressed to you. The more clearly it is expressed, the further it is from the truth, from its foundation.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Real goodness is not something that can be acquired in an instant, but only through constant effort, because real goodness lies in constantly striving for perfection.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Strive for goodness without any expectations for rapid or noticeable success. You will not see the results of your efforts, because the further you progress, the higher the ideal of perfection toward which you strive rises. The effort of striving for goodness, the process itself, justifies our lives.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: You should teach others with a good example, but if you teach with evil, then you do not teach, but destroy.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Sinful people had once accepted their right to punish others—and most of our misfortunes started from this.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: If you think someone is guilty of wronging you, forgive him. If you have never forgiven the guilty before, you will experience a new joy: the joy of forgiving.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Punishment is always cruel, always painful.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The strongest proof that in the name of “science” we pursue unworthy and sometimes even harmful things is the existence of a science of punishment, which in itself is one of the most ignorant and offensive types of action known to man, a vestige of the lowest level of human development, lower than that of a child or a madman.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The things we do to make our life more comfortable remind me of an ostrich who hides his head in order not to see his enemies. We behave even worse than an ostrich. In order to achieve some dubious questionable future, we definitely destroy our life in the clearly defined present time.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: People today foolishly try to believe that all the world’s senselessness and cruelty—the richness of the few, the great poverty of the many, the violence and warfare—happens outside their own lives and does not interfere with them and their way of life.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: A misconception remains a misconception, even when it is shared by the majority of the people.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: If life is good, then death which is the necessary part of life, is good as well.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Real life exists only in the present. The future has no meaning.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The purpose of real life is to fulfill the law of God, which exists eternally: it always existed, it exists now, and it always will exist.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: As soon as you go into the future or the past, you go away from God, and you feel lonely, deserted, and enslaved.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The future does not really exist. It is created by us in the present.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: There is a condition in which a person feels himself the architect of his life. It occurs when he concentrates all his efforts and all his intellect on the present moment.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: What time could be better than childhood, and what virtues could be better than innocent joyfulness, and the need for love? They are the purest manifestations of life. You should respect every person, but you should respect a child above all, and not destroy the innocent purity of his soul.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The knowledge we now accept as science interferes with more than it supports the goodness of human life.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Astronomy, mechanics, physics, chemistry, and all other sciences together and differently, all study the particular sides of life, but they do not come to any conclusion about the spiritual life of mankind.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: No matter how great our knowledge may be, it cannot help us fulfill our life’s major purpose—our moral perfection.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The voice of conscience makes no mistakes. It wants, not the fulfillment of the animal self, but its denial or sacrifice.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The voice of your conscience can always be singled out above the noise of your other wishes, because it always wants something seemingly useless, seemingly senseless, seemingly incomprehensible, but at the same time something actually beautiful and good, which can be achieved only through effort.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The real faith attracts people to itself not because it promises goodness to those who believe, but because it is the only escape, not only from all the problems and troubles and misfortunes of our life, but also from the fear of death.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: If you know that you lack faith, know also that you are in one of the most dangerous situations in this world a person can be in.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: It is bad not to have something for which you are ready to die.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Look at the causes of the misfortunes from which mankind suffers. Push beyond the obvious causes to the root causes, and you will inevitably find that the most basic, the most important cause of each and every one of humanity’s problems is the weakness of faith that comes from a false attitude to the world and its origin.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Salvation lies not in rituals and not in a particular creed, but in a clear understanding of the meaning of your life.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: You cannot serve both god and the devil. Merely tending to the growth of your wealth has nothing to do with the requirements of the truly spiritual life.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: It seems to me that the old prejudice that wealth brings happiness has begun to be discredited.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Do not fear poverty, but beware wealth.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: If only people who seek wealth could clearly see what they would lose by having it, they would put the same amount of effort into getting rid of this wealth as they now put into acquiring it.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: A wise man does not wish to change his situation, because he knows that it is possible to fulfill the law of God, the law of love, in every situation.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Try to establish an inner silence in yourself, a complete silence of your lips and your heart. Then you will hear how God speaks to us, and you will know how to fulfill His will.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The more upset a person is with other people, and with circumstances, and the more satisfied he is with himself, the further he is from wisdom.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Violence is harmful because it is usually dressed in wealth, and it therefore arouses some respect for those things which should arouse disgust.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: People who have power are sure that it is only violence that guides people, and so they use violence to support the existing order. But the existing order is not based on violence, but on public opinion.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: All violence is contrary to love: do not participate in violence.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The biggest obstacles to understanding the truth are lies disguised as truth.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The exposure of a lie is as valuable to a community as a clearly expressed truth.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The progress of mankind is in revealing obstacles which are hiding from us.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Doubts do not destroy truth; they strengthen it.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: You will have moments in which you no longer believe in the existence of the spiritual dimension of life. Look at these moments as events in the development of your faith. A person who understands the spiritual nature of life may still at some point become afraid of death, usually for a short period of time, in the same way that you can see as you watch a scene at the theater and forget that you are watching a play, and become scared by what you are seeing as if it were real.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: So it is in real life: in moments of self-delusion, a religious person forgets that what happens in his physical life cannot interfere with what happens in his spiritual life.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: In these periods, when your spirits have fallen, you have to treat yourself as an ill man.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: He who hesitates is not distanced from God; it is he who believes unhesitatingly in someone else’s word that God exists or does not exist who is far from God.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The individual ownership of large areas of land is as unjust as the ownership of other people.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The injustice of owning big pieces of land as prívate property, like any other injustice, is necessarily linked with many other injustices which are used to protect it.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Life’s essence lies, not in your body, but in your conscience.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Let your spiritual side guide your material side, and not the other way around. In order to improve his state, a person should strive for spiritual not physical perfection.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Nothing can enlighten people’s lives and ease their burdens more than the understanding that they should serve God.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Pay goodness for evil. We should be like trees that give fruits to those who throw stones at them.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: You should accept yourself, not as a master, but as a servant, and then all your bad feelings, your anxiety, alarm, uncertainty, and dissatisfaction will be changed into calmness and peace. You will be filled inside with a clear vision of your purpose, and with a great joy.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: All good things can be achieved only with effort.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: A person cries out from pain when he takes up hard physical work after a period of idleness. Any rest from the struggle for spiritual improvement brings the same pain.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The most important and necessary expression of freedom is to give your thought a specific direction.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Everything is in heaven’s power, except for our choice of whether to serve God or ourselves.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Faith in the existence of eternity is our exclusively human quality.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Death is the destruction of the bodily organs with which I see my world during my life; the destruction of the glass through which I look at this world. The destruction of this glass does not mean the destruction of the eye itself.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Our understanding of eternity is the voice of God who lives within us.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: No matter how big mankind’s store of knowledge seems to me in comparison with our previous ignorance, it is only an infinitely small part of all possible knowledge.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: It is better to know less than necessary than to know more than necessary. Do not fear the lack of knowledge, but truly fear unnecessary knowledge which is acquired only to please vanity.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: It would be possible to eat meat if it were justified by any serious considerations. But it isn’t; and meat eating is simply a bad thing that exists without any justification at all.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: If it were not so blindly accepted as a part of our customs and traditions, how could any sensitive person accept the thought that in order to feed ourselves we should kill such a huge number of animals, in spite of the fact that our earth gives us so many different treasures from plants?
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: There is a big difference between, on the one hand, a person who does not have access to any food except meat, and on the other, an educated person of today who lives in a country which has vegetables and milk in abundance, and who is instructed against meat eating. The educated person sins greatly if he continues to behave in a way he knows is wrong.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Work is not a virtue, but it is the necessary condition of a virtuous life.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Hurried work done in irritation attracts the unfavorable attention of others. Real work is always quiet, constant, and inconspicuous.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: For every idle person, there is another person who works too much. For every person who eats to excess, there is another person somewhere who is hungry.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Much of the activity of idle people who pretend that they are busy with work is merely entertaining; it just adds a burden to other people. This can be said of all luxuriant entertainments.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: All true wisdom and all true faith are clearly expressed in the same moral law.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Moral law is so obvious and clear that even people who do not know the law have no excuse for violating it. They have only one recourse: to deny their intellect, which they do.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Blaming others is an entertainment which some people like and cannot restrain themselves from. When you see all the harm this blaming causes, you see that it is a sin not to stop people from practicing this entertainment.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Truth is achieved through discussion, but the wiser man stops the arguments.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: As soon as you start blaming a person, stop yourself. Remember not to say something bad about someone, even if you know it to be true, and especially if you are not certain but are only repeating gossip.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Most people act, not according to their meditations, and not according to their feelings, but as if hypnotized, based on some senseless repetition of patterns.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: If, among the many voices which speak in my soul, I could only recognize my soul’s true voice, then I would never make mistakes, and never do evil. This is why it is necessary to know yourself.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: If you see that you are not behaving according to your inner desires, but because of some outer influence, stop and consider whether what drives you is good or bad.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Worse than all the troubles and horrors of war is the perversion of minds it causes. Armies exist and the cost of war exists, and people must wrestle to find explanations for what exists. War cannot be explained with the intellect, so to justify it, people create intellectual perversions.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Do not try to justify war or the existence of the military. If you try to apply logical thought to explain things that are evil, the effort will only prevent your intellect and poison your heart.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The more lonely a person is, the more clearly he can hear the voice of God.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The will to accomplish your good intentions depends on whether you voice them. You remember the things of which you spoke in your youth as if they were flowers that you tore out of a flower bed and threw away, and then saw lying on the earth, faded into the dirt.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Temporary solitude from all things in this life, the meditation within yourself about the divine, is food as necessary for your soul as material food is for your body.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: A sage is not afraid of lack of knowledge: he is not afraid of hesitations, or hard work, but he is afraid of only one thing—to pretend to know the things which he does not know.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Real wisdom comes, not from knowing what is good and what should be done, but from knowing which is the better thing and which is the worse, and therefore, what should be done and what should be done later.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: To be wise one must study both good and bad thoughts and acts, but one should study the bad first. You should first know what isnotclever, what isnotjust, and what isnotnecessary to do.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Religion is that which tells a person who he is and what the nature of the world in which he lives is.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: We should teach our children those principles that are common to all religions—Buddhist, Muslim, Christian, Jewish, and so on, that is, for the moral science of love and the unification of all people.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Most people do not listen to God but adore him. It is better not to adore but to listen.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Moral teaching is not complete if it is not religious, but religious teaching is useless if it is not based on morality, that is, if it does not lead to a good life.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Big wealth will not give you satisfaction. The more your wealth grows, the more your requirements grow with it.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: There are two ways not to suffer from poverty. The first is to acquire more wealth. The second is to limit your requirements. The first is not always within our power, but the second is always in our power.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Real love refers not just to love for a particular person but to the spiritual state of loving everyone.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: To love means to live within the lives of those whom you love.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Do not force others to love you; just love others, and you will be loved.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The more a person expresses his love, the more people love him; and the more people love him, the easier it is for him to love others. In this way, love is eternal.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Your spirit must constantly assert itself because your body is constantly exerting itself. As soon as you stop working at your spirit, then your body will have complete power over you.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: A good thing is always done with an effort, and when the effort is repeated several times, then a good thing becomes a habit.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Do not detest any action which helps you to achieve good, or even more importantly—which can prevent you from doing evil.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Illness should be viewed as a natural condition of life.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Neglecting your health can prevent you from serving people, and too much attention to your body and its health can bring the same results. In order to find the middle way, you should take care of your body only to the extent that doing so helps you to serve others, and does not stop you from serving them.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: No illness can prevent a person from what he has to do. If you cannot work, then give your love to people.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Do not be afraid of illness, and do not think that being ill frees you from your moral requirements.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: You can call God by various names, you can avoid his name altogether, but you cannot avoid accepting his existence. Nothing exists here if God does not exist.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: All I know I know because there is God, and I know Him because He gives me the knowledge of everything.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: It is very important to remember God, not necessarily with words, but in the sense of being aware of Him following your actions, supporting them or criticizing them. Russian peasants have a saying: “Do you remember God?”
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Only people who have never thought about life’s most important issues can believe that everything is possible for the human intellect.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: There are three types of people. First, there are people who do not believe in anything; then, there are people who believe only in those teachings they were brought up to believe. Finally, there are people who believe in those things which they understand with their hearts, and this last group of people is the wisest and most resolute.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Do not pretend to understand something that you do not. It is one of the worst possible things to do.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: A person who comes into an understanding of the life of his spiritual self cannot fear evil, either in life or in death.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Salvation in all things lies in their spirituality. Evil cannot touch a person who knows his spirituality.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: A man is both an animal and a spiritual being at the same time. As an animal, a man is afraid of death; as a spiritual being he does not experience death.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: In the last moments before death, the soul leaves the body. It unites with the limitless, timeless, and eternal soul and transforms into another form, we know not which. After death, our body is left behind, and it becomes only an object for observation.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Death marks a change, it marks the disappearance of the dwelling place of your conscience. The conscience itself cannot be destroyed by death, in the same way as the change of a theater set cannot destroy a spectator.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Perhaps you fear the changes that death will bring?
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: But a similar great change already happened at the time of your birth, and nothing bad came out of it.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Most people are proud, not of those things which arouse respect, but of those which are unnecessary, or even harmful: fame, power, and wealth.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: There is no worse scoundrel than he who, when he looks around himself at other people, can always find an even worse scoundrel than himself; and therefore, can be quite satisfied with himself.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: A person who loves himself has the advantage of having very few competitors.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: There is no wisdom in he who thinks that he is wise.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: A selfish person is always limited. And one is connected with the other: he is selfish because he is limited; he is limited because he is selfish.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: A proud person initially causes other people to think that he has more importance than he actually has, but when this influence disappears, as it always does, he becomes only the object of jokes.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: A society says to a man: “Think as we think, believe in what we believe, eat and drink what we eat and drink, and dress in the way we dress.”
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: It is bad to irritate people by stepping back from their customs and traditions, but it is even worse to deny the requirements of your conscience and intellect by following the customs of the crowd.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: A state system, no matter what kind of state system it is, functions at a far remove from the requirements of Christianity.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: State violence cannot be destroyed by decree, only by truth and love. Maybe state violence was necessary for previous generations; maybe it is even necessary now, but people should conceive of a kind of future government in which violence will not be necessary.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: You should live in such a way that violence is not necessary for you.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: People are taught to speak, but their major concern should be how to keep silent.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Keep silent. Give rest to your tongue more often than to your hands. You will never regret that you have kept silently but you will often regret that you spoke too much.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Your chief task in life is the care of your soul You should care for your soul and work to improve it, and you can improve it only with love.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The meaning of life lies in two major areas: your personal perfection and service to other people. You can serve while you are moving toward perfection, and you can move toward perfection by serving people.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: When I talk of moving toward perfection, I mean moving from a material to a spiritual plane, a plane of goodness, without time or death.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Only one step lies between a five-year-old child and a man of my age. Between a newborn baby and a five-year-old child lies a huge distance. Between a fetus and a newborn baby lies an abyss; and between nonexistence and a fetus lies not only an abyss, but a gulf that surpasses comprehension.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: From childhood to death, humans, no matter their lot in life, should strive to grow to get closer and closer to the spiritual life. Strive to learn what God wants, and your life will become filled with freedom and joy.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: God is in all of us, and it is possible for all of us to find and understand him there.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: To know yourself is to discover the good that lies within.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: If you are going through a hard time, work harder to understand God; as soon as you understand Him, all difficult things will become easy, and you will feel love and joy.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: If a person does not feel a divine force within himself, this does not mean that a divine force does not exist in him, but that he has not yet learned how to recognize it.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: If there are people and there is God, then there are relationships between God and people. These relationships are changing with time, and mankind’s religious conceptions are constantly evolving, constantly improving, becoming more clear and easily understood with the passage of time.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Religious conscience of mankind is not rigid, it is changing all the time, becoming purer and clearer.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: God is spirit and part of this spirit lives inside me and gives sense to my life.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: There is much good to be learned from the Koran, from the Buddhists, from Confucius, from the Old Testament, from the Indian Upanishads, and from the New Testament. But the closer a religious thinker or philosopher is to us in time, the more he can help us draw from these teachings in the light of our present-day lives.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The past no longer exists; the future has not yet come; there is only the present. And only in the present can the divine nature of the free human soul be manifested.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: If you want to do a good deed, do it now. The time will pass, and you will not have the chance again.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The meaning of life is revealed to those who are ready to accept the things which will be revealed. And it is he who has already decided that he will accept the truth as it is, and not the truth itself, which will change the way of life he has been accustomed to.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Who am I? What should I do? What should I believe in and what should I hope for?All of philosophy is in these questions, said the philosopher Lichtenberg. But among all these questions, the most important one is that which is in the middle. If a person knows what he should do, he will understand everything which he should know.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The real meaning of life is not possible to embrace, if you are looking for the universal meaning of life. And at the same time it is so simple that it can be explained to fools and to infants when what to know is what you should do as an individual.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: When you approach a man, you should think not about how he can help you, but how you might serve and help him.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: We have the necessary law for all our actions, and this law cannot be restricted by any power. The fulfillment of this law is possible even in prison, and under the threat of tortures and death.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Look for a kind life which is in harmony with the will of God, and then you will fulfill the duty of your life.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: In the same way as the storm troubles and muddies the waters, so too passions trouble our souls and interfere with our understanding of this life.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Real power is not in momentary desires, but in complete calmness.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Complete outer calmness is impossible. But when there are some calm periods, we should appreciate them and make them last longer. This is the time when useful thoughts appear; they become stronger and guide us in life.
