author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Make sure that you do not gossip about your brother.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Time passes, but the words which you say will remain.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: To stop your tongue from talking too much is a sign of great virtue.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: If you think that it is necessary to judge your neighbor, then say this looking directly into his eyes, and say this in such a way that you do not create animosity.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Conscience is the understanding of the divine beginning which lives in us.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: You cannot fight with the requirements of conscience. These are the rules of God, and it is better to submit to them.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: If the foundations of our life were not of the same nature in all of us, then we would not be able to explain to each other those feelings of compassion which we really experience.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: There are many people who are more unhappy than you. This message cannot be a roof under which you may live, but it will be enough of a roof under which you may hide from storms.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Real compassion begins only when you put yourself in the place of those who suffer, and you feel real suffering.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: A person can understand his purpose in the same way as he understands his dignity. Only a religious person can understand his purpose in life.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The freedom of a person is a great thing, and even the freedom of a whole nation begins from the freedom of a single individual.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: You should respect freedom in yourself, and in your neighbor, and in all people.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Only he who understands himself as a spiritual being can understand the spiritual dignity of other people. Such a person will not lower himself with any act which is not worthy of a spiritual person.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: For the moral, spiritual life, the importance of things is measured not by their material value, but by their level of goodness.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The majority of people want to do something unusual and difficult in order to improve their lives, but they would be better to purify their wishes, and improve their inner selves.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: To move yourself from the material to the spiritual means to do only spiritual things. My material body pulls my inner self to itself, but I try to separate my spiritual self from the material body. Though I use my body, I live within my spiritual life, which is my real life.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Real religion cannot be opposed to intellect.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: In order to understand the truth, you should not suppress your intellect. On the contrary, you should purify your intellect, exercise it, and intellectually try and test everything which we can possibly put to the test.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Those things which we call happiness and those which we call unhappiness are useful for us, especially when we see them as opportunities to try ourselves.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The legend about the wandering Jew who was suffering the punishment of eternal life is very true. In the same way, there is a legend about a man who was punished by being given a life without any suffering.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: There is nothing more important than an example. It leads us to do good deeds which would be impossible without this example. Therefore, if we use dissipated or passionate or cruel people as examples, it destroys our soul. The contrary is also true.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Those who do not think independently are under the influence of somebody else who thinks for them. If you give your thoughts to somebody else, it is a more shameful slavery than if you give your body to someone to possess.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: If you desire to follow someone as an example, as many other people do, first stop and think whether it is worthwhile to follow this general example.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Evil influence can be destroyed only by good influence. And the way to receive a good influence is to have a good life.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: A sense of self-importance so high that it surpasses all limits is a mental illness calledmania grandiosa.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: People think that self-sacrifice violates your freedom. Those people do not know that sacrifice gives us complete freedom, and frees us from ourselves, from the slavery of our dissipation.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Our passions are the most terrible tyrants, and we can be the slave of them. Only self-sacrifice can free us from this slavery.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: If you teach others how many insects exist in this world, or when you look at the spots on the sun, or when you write an opera or a novel—we do these things for different purposes. But to teach people goodness is done only for the purpose of self-sacrifice, service to others, and you cannot express this teaching without self-sacrifice. Christ gave his life on the cross for a great purpose, not in vain. And a sacrifice or suffering is never in vain, and it will triumph over everything.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Nothing can interfere with the growth of truth in the world: nothing except the wish to save old prejudices.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Humanity slowly but ceaselessly moves forward to the better and better understanding of the meaning of this life.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Among the most terrible lies of all is to teach false faith to children.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Disrespect for traditions has not caused even one thousandth part of the great evil which was caused by the old prejudices, traditions, customs, and institutions which should not exist at present.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: A man who considers himself the master of his own life can never be humble, because he thinks that he has no obligation to anyone. The man who considers service to God to be the purpose of his life is always humble, because he feels that he has never fulfilled his obligations.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: A deed done only to achieve glory is always bad, no matter what consequences it has. A deed motivated equally by the desire to achieve goodness and to achieve glory is indifferent. A deed is truly good only when its motivation is to fulfill the law of God.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: If you care too much about being praised, in the end you will not accomplish anything serious. People have different values. You may say, “I want good people to value me,” but you know you will respect only those who praise your actions.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Let the judgments of others he the consequence of your deeds, not their purpose.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: To live only for God, you should do good works which no one will ever discover. Do so, and you will experience a special joy.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: There is only one real law, the law of God, which is the same for all of mankind. Human law can be valid only when it is in harmony with the law of God.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The first and most difficult obstruction to the fulfillment of the law of God is the fact that our society’s existing laws are completely opposed to this law.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: In order to study the most important questions of life, everyone should destroy the prejudices and lies which were created by previous centuries in relation to all serious questions in life.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The law of God contradicts human law. So what should we do? Should we hide the law of God and proclaim human law? People have done this for almost nineteen centuries, and the contradiction becomes stronger and stronger. There is only one solution: to replace the existing laws with the law of God.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Debates conceal the truth more often than they reveal it. Real truth should be revealed in solitude. When it is revealed, it becomes clear to you that you can accept it without any argument or discussions.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: He has power who can keep silent in an argument, even though he is right.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The more urgently you want to speak, the more likely it is that you will say something foolish.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Thought is the glorification of truth; therefore, bad thoughts are those which have not been thought through to the end.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: You cannot send away a bad thought when it appears in your mind, but you can create other thoughts which will weaken or destroy this bad thought. For example, I may imagine that your friend or neighbor has some drawback, and I may not be able to banish this thought, but when I concentrate on the thought that criticizing another person is bad because I am not perfect, and he has the same God within him as I have within me, then I cannot stop loving this person.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Blaming your neighbor is harmful, both for you and for others.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Yesterday at a party, when a guest said good-bye and departed, everyone who was left started to slander him. The same thing happened to the second person when he left, and to all the guests, one after another, as they left. The last guest said, “Let me stay here and spend the night. I saw that all the people who left suffered and I am afraid for myself.”
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: I once met an old man who spoke very slowly, pausing for several seconds between his words. He did this because he was afraid to sin with his words.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Let us forgive each other. If we can forgive each other, then we can live in peace.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: A word is an expression of thoughts; thoughts are the expression of divine force. Therefore, words should correspond to our true meaning. Speech can be indifferent, but it should not be an expression of evil.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: You can look at life as death, and death as an awakening.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: We ask the wrong question when we say, “What will happen after death?” When we speak about the future, we speak of time, but when we die, we leave time behind.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: We come to a right understanding of our life in relation to God in the same way we understand our relation to the world and to its things. Without conscience, we would never know anything about God.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: A good worker probably does not know the details of the life of his master. Only a lazy worker tries to do nothing except find out more about his master’s way of life, tastes, and preferences in order to please him. The same is true of a person’s attitude to God. It is important to accept Him as your master and to know what He wants you to do. I may never know the answers to the questions “What is He?” and “How does He live?” I will never find out because I am not equal to Him. I am His worker, not His master.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Every person understands God in different ways, but people fulfill His will in the same way.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Self-admiration is the beginning of pride. Pride is dissipated self-admiration.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The most important thing in life is the path to perfection, and what kind of perfection can exist if a person is proud and satisfied with himself?
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: From the first moment the members of a religious gathering said, “The Holy Spirit is among us,” when they claimed theirs the highest authority above all other authorities, when they accepted the results of their own meditation as more worthy than the divine spark that exists in every person (that is, the intellect and the conscience), from this time, a great lie originated, a lie which deceives the bodies and souls of many people, which has destroyed millions of human beings, and which continues its terrible work.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: If there is a true church, the people who are inside it cannot see it from the outside.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Moral perfection is the impossible goal, but moving to it is the law of human life.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Some people say, “Man is selfish, greedy, and dissipated, and cannot be kind to other people.” This is not true. We can be good. Feel in your heart the kind of person you should be; this feeling will give you power.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: A woman accidentally dropped a precious pearl into the sea, and she started to scoop ocean water with a spade, one cup after another. A sea-sprite came to her and said, “When will you stop scooping up water?” The woman said, “When I have taken all the water from the sea, and retrieved my pearl from the bottom.” Then the sea-sprite retrieved the pearl and returned it to her.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Outer consequences are not in oar power to control; it is only possible to make an effort, and inner consequences always follow from our effort.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The land is the general and equal possession of all humanity, and therefore cannot be the property of individuals.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The possession of land as property is one of the most unnatural crimes there is. We cannot see the horror of this crime because in our world it is accepted as law.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Self-perfection should be one’s primary motivation. If you are truthful to yourself, you will never be satisfied with yourself.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Those who live life in perfection look only forward; those who have stopped moving forward look back on their achievements.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Dissatisfaction is a necessary condition of intellectual life. It is only this dissatisfaction that pushes you to work.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The most important knowledge is that which guides the way you lead your life.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: It is harmful to eat if you are not hungry. It is even worse to have sex if you lack desire. But even more harmful is to try to think when you do not wish to, or to be engaged in meaningless intellectual activity. Many people do so when they want to improve their position.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: What is important in knowledge is not quantity, but quality. It is important to know what knowledge is significant, what is less so, and what is trivial.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The joy of wealth is inconstant.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: For those who live a spiritual life, wealth is not only unnecessary but uncomfortable. It stops the development of one’s real life.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Faith answers those questions to which the intellect cannot find answers, but which must be asked.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: We have only one sinless guide, a universal spirit which gets into all of us though we are all individuals, and which gives us the urge to do all that is necessary. The same spirit which exists in a tree and pushes it to grow straight and to produce seeds exists in us, urges us to be closer to God, and brings us closer to each other.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: When a person is alive, he believes; the closer his faith is to the truth, the happier his life. The further from the truth his faith is, the more unhappy he is.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Without faith he does not live; he dies a premature death or else kills himself.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: We suffer from the past, and we spoil our future because we neglect the present.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The best the future can offer is dreams. There is only one thing which really exists: the present.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: There is no past and no future; no one has ever entered those two imaginary kingdoms. There is only the present. Do not worry about the future, because there is no future. Live in the present and for the present, and if your present is good, then it is good forever.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: If you have difficult times, if you suffer from the loss of loved ones or from fears about the future, remember that life exists only in the present and direct all your thoughts and memories to this present. All your anguish about the past and your worries about the future will disappear, and you will feel freedom and happiness.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: You cannot measure good by either the feeling of need or sacrifice, but only by the communication with God which is established between the giver and the receiver.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: All people become closer, more or less, to one of two opposite limits: one is life only for oneself, and the other is life only for God.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: We do good only when we do not notice what we do, when we forget ourselves and live only in others.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: A material evil done by a person does not return to the evildoer, but the evil feeling which was created by the sinful deed will fester in his soul and sooner or later make him suffer.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: There is no material goodness which can restore the soul after the damage done by the evil which you create.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Remember: Those who suffer through to the end will be saved. Very often a person becomes desperate or even stops in his purpose when only a small effort is needed to achieve it.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Persecution and suffering are the necessary conditions of the fulfillment of Christian law. Persecution is precious because it reveals whether a person lives with real faith.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Do not seek love in other people, and do not complain about the absence of their love for you. Some people love wrong, not right; therefore, try to please God, rather than people.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: There is no deed in this life so impossible that you cannot do it. Your whole life should be lived as an heroic deed.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: I am the tool with which God works. My virtue is to participate in this work, and I can do so if I keep the instrument which is given to me, namely my soul, in immaculate condition.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: All things, even the most complicated things, become simple and clear if you separate them from other people and place them before God for judgment.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Other than our service to God, all our actions, whether we consider them important or not, are completely trivial. We may not know what the consequences of our actions will be, but we know what we should do.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The more busy you are with the improvement of your inner life, the more active you become in social life, helping other people.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Never build, but always plant: in the case of the first, nature will interfere and destroy the creation of your work, but in the case of the second, nature will help you, causing growth in everything you planted. The same thing happens in your spiritual life: those things which are in harmony with the eternal laws of human nature will grow, but those things which correspond to the temporal wishes of people will not.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The question of life’s meaning is a difficult problem which cannot be solved. So, too, is the question, “Why did God send us into this world?” But the meaning of life becomes very simple when a person asks himself, “What shouldIdo?”
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Your life may be cut short at any time; therefore, your life should have a deep purpose, a significance that will not depend on whether it is short or long.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: There is only one way, if you want to live without understanding the meaning of your life: to become addicted to tobacco, alcohol, and drugs, and to live in the world of permanent entertainment.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: This world is not a joke but rather a place for a trial, a way station to a better, eternal world. Our purpose is to make it a better and more joyous place to live, for those who live with us and those who come after us.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Our soul’s perfection is our life’s purpose; any other purpose, keeping death in mind, has no substance.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Helping others takes the form not only of physical aid, but of spiritual support for your neighbor. Stop blaming your neighbor and respect his human dignity.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: He is virtuous who does not pay any attention to libel and evil speech.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Try not to hide the shameful memories of your sins in dark corners. On the contrary, keep them close to you and remember them, before you judge your neighbor.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: War is murder. No matter how many people get together to commit murder or what they call themselves, murder is the worst sin in the world.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The majority of people now understand not only the uselessness, but also the stupidity and cruelty of any war.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Until such time as people reject the power of government to govern, to tax, to legislate, and to punish, war will never stop. War is the consequence of the government’s power.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Just as one candle lights another and can light thousands of other candles, so one heart illuminates another heart and can illuminate thousands of other hearts.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Good books are a good influence. Good art is a good influence. Prayer is an influence as well. But the strongest influence is the example of a good life. A good life becomes a blessing for people, not only for those who live good lives but those who can see, know, and understand such lives.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Beware of groups of people who are harmful for your soul. Try to avoid them. You should praise good company and seek it.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: If a passion embraces you, you should remember that this passionate desire is not a part of your soul, but a dark covering which shuts out the true qualities of your soul.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: As soon as you feel passion, try to feel in yourself the understanding of your divine nature. As soon as you perceive that your divine nature is inactive and that you are possessed by passions, fight with these passions.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Life is not destroyed, only changed, by death.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Faith in the eternity is given to us not in meditation, but in life.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: It is not reasoning which will convince you of the necessity of life after death, but example: when you walk very close to a person, hand in hand, and this person disappears into an abyss,over there, stop in front of the abyss and try to look within it.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The level of fear you feel about death is the level of your understanding of life.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The less you fear death, the more you possess freedom, tranquillity, and an understanding of the greatness of your spirit and the joy of life.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The understanding of eternity is part of the nature of the human soul.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: A word is an action.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Your enemies can be more useful to you than your friends, because your friends can often pardon your weaknesses, but your enemies notice them and attract your attention to them.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Do not neglect the opinion of your enemies.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Never is there a single instance when a lie can be justified.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: When a humble person forgets himself, he is united with God.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The more humble a person is, the freer and stronger be is.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: A woman does not differ from a man in her chief mission. This mission is to serve God. The difference is in the method of this service. Though the mission of a woman’s life is the same as that of a man’s life and the service to God is fulfilled by the same means, namely love, for the majority of women the method of this service is more specific than for men. This is the birth and upbringing of new workers for the Lord throughout life.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: It is not usually husbands who choose their wives, but wives who choose their husbands. In order to find a better father for her children, a woman must know good and evil. Therefore, women should have a good education first of all.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: There is nothing more natural for a woman than self-sacrifice. Nothing can be more unpleasant in her than selfishness.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: “Do not kill”: these word refer not just to the killing of a person, but to the killing of anything which is alive. This commandment was written in the people’s hearts even before it was heard on Mt. Sinai.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Whatever arguments they use against vegetarianism, men cannot prevent themselves from feeling compassion and disgust at killing sheep, cows, or chickens. Most people would rather stop eating meat than kill these animals themselves.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The more people become educated and the more our population grows, the more people will move from eating animals to eating plants.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The stupidity, lawlessness, and harm, both physical and moral, of meat eating is so clear that meat eating is not supported by reasoning but by old traditions and prejudices. We should not even argue about the absence of logic in eating meat; it is self-evident.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Art is the activity whereby a person makes a conscious attempt to use the particular means at his disposal to transmit his feelings to others so that they feel them as intensely as he does.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: In a true creation of art, there is not only no border between the work of art and the artist, but also between the work and the other people who experience it. The major attraction of real art lies in this unification.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: A new work of art should bring a new emotion in our life.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Emerson said that music helps people to find the greatness in their souls. The same can be said about any form of art.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Contemporary artists and scholars do not fulfill and cannot fulfill their destinies, because they have transformed their duties into their rights.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: It is not said by chance that the essence of divine law is to love God and your neighbor. Neighbors come and go, but God exists always. Therefore, a man can fulfill this law when he is alone in a desert, or when he is in prison. He can love God and God’s manifestations even in his thoughts, memories, and imagination.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Remember that the spirit of God exists in every person, the same spirit that gives you life. Therefore you should not only love but respect the soul of every person as a holy place.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Do not do anything, either among others or alone, which is opposed by your conscience.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Beyond his duty to his neighbor, every person has an obligation to himself, as to the Son of God.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The longer mankind exists, the more liberated it becomes from prejudice and the more clearly it perceives the law of life.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Do not be afraid of the way your intellect calls into question old stories and legends. The pure intellect cannot destroy anything without replacing it with the truth: this is one of its essential qualities.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: We have misconceptions not because we think illogically but because we live our lives badly.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The fight between the spiritual and material inner nature goes on in everyone. Thus, all people have misconceptions, and many will always mistake them for the truth.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: To feed the hungry, to clothe the naked, to visit the ill in the hospital—these are acts of mercy, but there is one charitable deed which cannot be compared to them: to free your brother from misconception.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Life consists of numerous invisible, imperceptible changes, changes that began at birth and end with death. It is not possible for us humans to observe them all.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Death is a change to a form with which our spirit is united. You should not confuse the form with those things with which it is united.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: It seems so easy to fulfill the law of God that is expressed in the Christian teaching, but we are still so far from this fulfillment!
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Man’s purpose is to serve all mankind, not to serve only one man while doing harm to others.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: For a Christian, the love of one’s motherland can be an obstacle to the love of one’s neighbor.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Patriotism is not a virtue. Sacrificing your life for an institution which embodies prejudice cannot be your duty.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: People do many bad things for selfish reasons; they do worse things for their families. But they do the worst in the name of patriotism, and they are made proud by these crimes: spying, unduly heavy tax collecting, sacrificing lives, and waging wars.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Loving your country and loving your family are both virtues that can become vices when they become overwhelming and damage your love for your neighbor.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: One of the worst things possible is to follow the rule: “Be like everyone, follow the crowd.”
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: There is no evil in the world itself. All evil exists in our souls, and can be destroyed.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Nothing is more joyful than the labor of a farmer tilling the soil.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Working on the land and making your own bread isn’t necessary for all people, but no type of work is more important for humanity, and no type of work offers a greater degree of independence and good.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Kindness defeats everything and can never be defeated.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: If a good action has an ulterior cause, then it is not truly good. If it expects reward, it is not truly good. Good things are beyond reason and consequence.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: We do good to people not in hope of reward, but because we see the divine spirit within everyone.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The best and easiest way to thwart evil in this world is to respond to it with kind words, return an evil action with good.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: True faith is faith only if the actions of your life are in harmony with it and never contradict it.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: We can never fully understand the final purpose of human life. A construction worker who works at a construction site can have no idea of the final form or general design of the large structure he builds, but he can know that he is working on something good, something beautiful, clever, and necessary, both for him and for the world. This is faith.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Do not believe in words, yours or others’; believe in the deeds.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Those who can raise their thoughts to heaven will always have clear days, because the sun always shines above the clouds.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: If you are gnawed by desire or fear you must not believe in God, who is filled with love, and who exists in you. If you believe in Him, you know that you need not wish for anything because the wishes of God always come true; and you need never be afraid of anything, because God fears nothing.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Whatever may happen to you, you will never be unhappy if you understand your unification with God.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Only misconceptions need to be supported by elaborate arguments. Truth can always stand alone.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: A person cannot be completely truthful all the time, because different forces and aspirations fight within him, and sometimes he cannot express them, even to himself.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Misconceptions exist only for a finite period of time, but real truth remains as it always was, after all tricks, sophisms, and lies have withered away.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Learn what to do, think, and say the truth at all times. Only when you start to learn this can you understand how far we are from real truth.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Lies are always harmful to all living things.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: No person is without sin; no person is completely truthful. It is not that one person is virtuous and truthful and another is sinful and deceitful; rather it’s that one person strives to move toward truth and virtue and the other does not.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Only the spread of love between people can improve the existing social structure.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Love gives meaning to human life. This we have known since antiquity. But what is love? Many wise people throughout the ages have tried to solve this question.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Only one clear quality marks an action as either good or evil: If it increases the amount of love in the world, it is good. If it separates people and creates animosity among them, it is bad.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The time is coming, a time of concord, harmony, forgiveness, and love. Depend on it. We must do everything in our power to bring this time closer, and to stop those things which delay its arrival.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Our understanding of ourselves as discrete beings separate from each other grows out of conditions of our life in time and space. The less we feel this separation, the more we feel our unification with all other living creatures, the lighter our load, and the more joyful our life will be.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: We manifest in love our understanding of the unity of our being with others, and in so doing we make our life greater. The more we love, the wider, larger, and more joyful our life becomes.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Mankind moves ceaselessly toward perfection, not of every person’s accord, but through the efforts that some particular individuals make toward their personal perfection. The kingdom of God will be created by these individual efforts.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: We hear often that there is no use in working to improve our life, to fight evil, or to establish justice, because progress will occur by itself. Imagine that a boat floats along a river. Imagine that those who have sat by the oars and rowed tirelessly have stopped and gone ashore; and that the travelers who remain in the boat do not bother to take up the oars and push the boat further, but think that it will travel by itself, as before, into the future.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Every person should make a small effort, even the smallest effort, to improve the general well-being of humanity.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Real goodness is in your hands. It follows a good person as a shadow follows its object.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The greater the effort a person makes to achieve pleasure, the less possible it is for him to possess real goodness, or love.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: They who say that doing good causes them unhappiness either don’t believe in God or aren’t doing something that is truly good.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The real purpose of Christianity is obvious to all, and it is stronger than the lies which try to pervert it.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: I see a new religion based on mutual trust, which appeals to our deepest selves, and which teaches that a person should love goodness without reward, and that the divine exists in everyone.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Do not think that you will personally see the coming of the kingdom of God. But have no doubt that it will come soon: it is coming closer and closer, without hesitation.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: At the highest level of consciousness, an individual is alone. Such solitude can seem strange, unusual, even difficult. Foolish people try to escape it by means of various dissipations in order to get away from this high point, to some point lower, but wise people remain at this high point, with the help of prayer.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: God wants us to fulfill his will here on earth, in our lives. But life’s interests and passions distract us from this every minute. When we understand this, we can gird ourselves with the physical expression of our attitude to God, prayer.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: A personality is a limitation and, therefore, God, as we understand Him, is not a personality. Prayer is our address to God and yet how can we address one who has no personality? I address God as if He were a person, though I know it is not so.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: A person buried in a deep mine, freezing from the cold in deep ice, dying from hunger alone on the open sea, wasting away in solitude in a prison cell, or simply dying at home, deaf and blind—how could this person live out the remainder of his life if prayer did not exist?
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: One can live without prayer either when he is possessed by his passions or when his life is completely dedicated to God. But for a person who is fighting his passion and yet far from fulfilling his duty, prayer is a necessary condition of life.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Nothing seems to check the notion that the way to improve civilization is affected by changing its outer forms. This notion is false, and draws the activity of too many people away from effort that truly can improve our lives.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: When we accept false and violent laws and submit to them, we can neither establish truth nor combat lies in this world.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Wisdom is understanding how eternal truth can be applied to life.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Socrates was the first who brought philosophy from heaven, distributed it among the people, and enticed them to study the science of life, human morals, and the consequences of good and evil.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Science is seldom connected with wisdom. A scholarly person knows many unnecessary things. A wise person knows few things, but all that he knows is necessary both for humanity and for himself.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The goodness given to us by wisdom compares to all other knowledge in the same way that in a desert, a vessel filled with water compares to mountains of gold.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Starting from early childhood, as we age we feel the growth of our spiritual power and the diminution of our physical power.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The growth of our physical energy prepares us for spiritual work, for serving God and mankind; this work starts when our body begins to fade away.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Grow spiritually and help others to do so; it is the meaning of life.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Terrible is the situation of those who cannot perceive spiritual growth in themselves. They can see only physical life, which will disappear in time.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: When you understand your spiritual being and live with it, then instead of despairing you understand the joy that can never be destroyed, which always grows.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Kindness and virtue come from the heart, and should be performed without thought for the opinion of others, or of future rewards.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Virtue and charity start at home. If you have to go somewhere to display it, then it is not virtue.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Assistance given to the poor by the rich is too often just a gesture of politeness, not real charity.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Charity is good only when it comes as a sacrifice; only then do those who receive the material gift receive the spiritual gift too. If it is not a sacrifice but a discharge of excess, it can only irritate those who receive it.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Childhood is the period in which underlying convictions are formed. Therefore, the most important part of education is the selection of the things of which a child should be convinced.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Talking and reasoning does not even have one thousandth the influence a true example has. All lessons about how to behave are worthless when children see the opposite in real life.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: It is important to teach children kindness and simplicity in life and work. All of children’s moral and spiritual education should be supported by your own good example. You should live virtuously, or at least try to do so; the success of your good life will educate your children.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: All that we see and know does not exist in reality, because it is the product of our limited ability to understand reality.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Old fortresses are destroyed, monuments to kings are demolished, old age ravages our bodies. Only the teachings of kindness are never ruined or affected by age.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: As soon as a person truly looks at himself as only a physical body, then he sees an unsolved puzzle, a contradiction that cannot be unraveled.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: In order to understand the true essence of a thing we must transform the physical into the spiritual.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Science is vitally important when it is harnessed to reveal the law of human life.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: In order to accept the importance of science, we must prove that this activity is useful. Scientists usually demonstrate that they are doing something and that maybe sometime, someday, this could be useful for people in the future.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: “Science” is not quite the concept which people use this word to identify; it is the highest, most important, most necessary object of our understanding.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The wild instinct of military murder has developed in humanity over the course of thousands of years, and has become rooted in our brains. We must hope that our society will be able to rid itself of this terrible crime.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Wars can be stopped only if people are ready to be persecuted for not participating in them. This is the only way.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The understanding of the fraternity and equality of all people becomes more and more popular among mankind.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Family and motherland are but two circles that are part of the wider circle that is humanity. Those who teach morality and who limit one’s duties only to family and country teach a selfishness which is dangerous for all of us.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The understanding of one’s unity with all of humanity comes from the understanding of the divine beginning in us all, and gives all our greatest good. True religion creates this understanding, and different prejudices interfere with it—prejudice of state, nation, and class.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The past does not exist. The future has not begun. The present is an infinitely small point in time in which the already nonexistent past meets the imminent future. At this point, which is timeless, a person’s real life exists.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Time is behind us, time is before us, but in the present there is no time.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Time does not exist. There is only a small and infinite present, and it is only in this present that our life occurs. Therefore, a person should concentrate all his spiritual force only on this present.
author: Leo Tolstoy
